Comment: The experience lived up to the legend and hype. The beautiful location, wonderful staff, and incredible food made an impression on all our team during a constructive trip to New York.

Name: Daniel
Comment: I love Daniel but haven't been to this restaurant in years.  Some of the food was "overdone."  Abalone had a sauce on it and I didn't even recognize the abalone.  Fois gras was fabulous.  Duck was grand as well Il flotante overdone, dry.  Wine pairings amazing.

Name: Daniel
Comment: I haved a wonderful and exciting time🤍

Name: Daniel
Comment: Chef Daniel comes out to each table and makes it an incredible personal experience! Beautiful dining room, delicate and delicious food, impeccable attentive service.

Name: Daniel
Comment: I haven't provided a review in ages.  This was an extraordinary dining experience.  Truly extraordinary.  Every dish was perfectly executed aesthetically and mind blowing delicious.  The service was flawless.  We had a girl's night in the city and my friend is vegan, and they accommodated her restrictions without hesitation...and I enjoyed a non-vegan tasting menu that was beautifully executed.  The wine pairings were also done to perfection.  We had a lovely and most memorable evening -- this dining experience goes down in our history books.   Five stars, a standout in a massive city with so many restaurants, it's hard to choose.

Name: Daniel
Comment: Absolutely AMAZING experience! If you haven’t dined at Daniel go now! Wonderful melt in your mouth experience from beginning to end. ♥️

Name: Daniel
Comment: The ambiance was pleasant. The service impeccable. The food innovative.

Name: Daniel
Comment: Exquisite is the best way to describe  the food, service, and ambiance.  From the moment you enter you are made to feel as though you are their only guest. We tried the 7 course tasting menu with the wine pairing and it's obvious that Daniel has everything perfected. The tastes my tongue experienced were out of this world. I can say every dish exceeded my expectations.  The bison and mushroom aperitifs were my personal favorite and I'm usually not a fan of mushrooms.  They even provided personal touches that made it a night we'll never forget.  The staff were so attentive and not in any way rushing you.  I cannot wait to return and of course I highly recommend Daniel to all.

Name: Daniel
Comment: Celebrating an anniversary

Name: Daniel
Comment: Wonderful service and amazing food at Daniel. Made a special night even more special.

Name: Daniel
Comment: Perfection

Name: Daniel
Comment: Do you really need a review for what is arguably the best restaurant in NYC?  It is not inexpensive, but really, if you're reading this, you knew that already.  Service, impeccable.  Food, outstanding.  No better place for a special occasion.   Bonus, Chef Boulud was in the dining room.  I don't know, maybe he's there all the time, but it was cool to see.

Name: Daniel
Comment: This was our third year going to Daniel for our birthday dinner. My daughters share the same birthday, three years apart and I follow a couple of weeks after so we have made it a tradition to go to New York to celebrate. Our first time at Daniel was so amazing we decided it would be our yearly tradition and it has never disappointed. Not only is each plate beautiful and delicious the service and ambiance simply cannot be matched!

Name: Daniel
Comment: Food and service excellent as always. They even made a special dessert when I found I couldn’t eat what was offered.

Name: Daniel
Comment: Amazing as always!!!  Thank to Elvir for the kitchen tour and chef Will!  Amazing food and service!

Name: Daniel
Comment: My wife and I loved the experience it was superb in every level.I want to give props to the manager Kareem who made sure everything was perfect thru our evening and took us to the kitchen for a photo up.We will definitely be back.

Name: Daniel
Comment: Daniel is amazing! Unforgettable dinner.

Name: Daniel
Comment: Best restaurant in Manhattan,  just amazing food. The service and ambiance are reminiscent of the best Parisian places.

Name: Daniel
Comment: The service was remarkable and outstanding.  The hosts, the sommelier, and the servers went over and beyond to ensure our comfort. We had the four course tasting.  The dessert course was amazing and kept getting better with each offering.  However, the other three courses were very disappointing.  the presentation was good but the taste was not what we expected from a restaurant of this caliber.  It was not pleasing to our palate. Considering the price we pay at this restaurant, we were expecting a lot more in terms of taste.

Name: Daniel
Comment: Incredible tastes and service. They handled dietary restrictions with ease. Very special place

Name: Daniel
Comment: Without a doubt one of the most outstanding meals of our lives. The finest combination of cuisine, service, and ambiance in the United States, if not the world. We were awed by the tasting dinner. Every staff member was superb. Special appreciation to our sommelier who recommended a wonderful wine that was also a good value. We’ll always remember this great evening at Restaurant Daniel.

Name: Daniel
Comment: First visit to this legendary restaurant and it totally lived up to it’s reputation.Will return.

Name: Daniel
Comment: a fabulous dining experience. Outstanding Menu , great Presentation and first rate service.A true memorable culinary experience!!!

Name: Daniel
Comment: The experience at Daniel was absolutely AMAZING. Everyone was very kind and thoughtful for our special day. The Chef even sent us a customized "Congratulations" desert made with white chocolate and exotic fruits - we very much appreciated this attention. As well as the fresh and warm Madeleines, a delicious french Canelet and mini home-made chocolates using the finest chocolates from all over world. And Thank you again for the very pretty customized menus printed in grand elegance for us. Daniel restaurant  is a true highlight for people who want to experience something which is truly special and unique. We will come back soon. Merci infiniment.

Name: Daniel
Comment: Thank goodness there is still an exceptional dining experience around. I’d almost given up on dining out. Every place was the same uninspiring Upscale gastro pub trying to put a new spin on old recipes. So many places didn’t live up to the hype. Daniel is the definition of fine elegant dining. Every bite was creative and perfectly balanced- a foodie’s dream. Checks all the boxes of what I look for when seeking a new exciting experience. 1. He created things I would never imagine- familiar flavors blended into something new and sensational.2. I could never create this in my house.3. Creates a whole world and experience. For three hours I was removed from time and space and enjoyed one Devine culinary sensory sensation after another of taste smells and textures.Hit every note perfectly like a symphony- the room decor, the lighting, the service, the timing, the wine,  and of course the food.If you are a true foodie ( in search of the next great bit- no matter where - fine dining to food cart) then you must experience Daniel and if you miss and are in search of a whole true fine dining experience put Daniel somewhere top of your list.

Name: Daniel
Comment: 30th wedding anniversary meal went 5 years previous and did not disappoint nothing’s cheap in New York really so well worth a visit for a special occasion with a quality taste experience and very attentive staff

Name: Daniel
Comment: Very classic and nice setting. Was lucky to see the chef and have a picture with him.

Name: Daniel
Comment: Valentine’s Day; the special menu was astronomically priced even in relation to other fine-dining NYC tasting menus

Name: Daniel
Comment: Absolutely amazing. Better than Le Bernardin.

Name: Daniel
Comment: One of five must go spots in Manhattan for special occasions. Very pricey but you get what you pay for. Our Valentines Saturday lunch was superb with unmatched seating due to the earlier time. From the reception to departure the highly trained staff makes you welcome with knowledge and lack of pretense. All the four courses were elegant to behold and a symphony of flavors. The dessert course is a profusion of riches crafted under the supervision is the Pastry chef Ghaya Olivera and is equal to the best in the world. Drinks are special with a stellar and expensive list of curated wines. Very highly recommended for anyone’s bucket list. Bravo!

Name: Daniel
Comment: Dinner at Valentine’s Day.The food was great as always. Price was double due to Valentine’s Day. Table was close to the entrance door. Rush service. Unfortunately, I felt it was a sloppy night.

Name: Daniel
Comment: Great time with another couple for V day ,

Name: Daniel
Comment: Elvir is awesome!!!

Name: Daniel
Comment: It was wonderful!

Name: Daniel
Comment: This was one of our favorite dinners Ever!! The service was impeccable. The food was extraordinary. The wine was spectacular!! We will continue to eat at Daniel every time we make it to NYC!! Thank you Daniel for an exceptional dining experience!

Name: Daniel
Comment: Fantastic restaurant in Classic Style. Appropriate interior design. Great service. Amazing food.Overall excellent experience.

Name: Daniel
Comment: Love Daniel been there few time always excellent on every way!!!

Name: Del Posto
Comment: Great meal and experience before everything had to shut down

Name: Del Posto
Comment: Everything was excellent— the food, the service, the space. We dined here because our first and second choices were closed due to COVID-19. This was not our first or second choice because there are many other restaurants with just as excellent food and service but much better value.

Name: Del Posto
Comment: The brodo was too salty.  The Sommelier was fantastic and did an outstanding job of pairing our food selections.  The pork was impeccably done -  beautiful taste.   Overall, a great restaurant, but the price is over the top so it is always going to be a treat.

Name: Del Posto
Comment: We were adventurous & selected the chef’s table 8 courses with wine. Totally fabulous! We had such a wonderful evening with friends that was fill with conversation & good food. The pasta was so light light & delicious I’m envious of the still of those tiny cheese or potato filled delights. My husband loved the flavorful soup course. Best part I stayed on my diet & still lost weight! Gave me new meaning to portion control! It’s so relaxing to be be not rushed to next course to turn over the table. Can’t wait to go back!

Name: Del Posto
Comment: Outstanding meal and service is perfect.

Name: Del Posto
Comment: Visited from California for our 10 year wedding anniversary. They sat us late for our reservation. Took a long time to get served wine. Somalíes was unfriendly, uptight, and not helpful. She accidentally poured my husband a glass of red that he did not order spilling it in the process then when she realized she accidentally poured it she made a big scene of taking it off the table. When I asked her what she did with the glass of wine she said it’s a wash it’s just sitting in the back. For the price of the meal you would think she would just leave the glass for my husband to enjoy.  The restaurant is beautiful looks like a movie set but the meal and service was not worth the price of a fine dining experience.

Name: Del Posto
Comment: Visited with my college daughter and teen son on a visit to NYC. It was the highlight meal of our trip, as in the past.Love everything about this amazing restaurant!

Name: Del Posto
Comment: Overpriced but worth it! Great food and service as well as ambiance!

Name: Del Posto
Comment: Mind blowing food experience

Name: Del Posto
Comment: Inventive but excellent food, soothing surroundings, and top-notch service!

Name: Del Posto
Comment: Hubby and I went here after dry January to have an amazing dinner and delicious drinks. I mean is Mario’s restaurant so it’s gonna be sick!!! Our server (forget his name) was awesome. Loved his Italian accent and when he explained the wine pairing with each course. We did the 8 course menu which every bite was better than the first. The wine was sooooooooo good. Can’t wait to go back. You’re gonna pay when doing the wine pairing but it’s soooo worth it. You only live once.

Name: Del Posto
Comment: Amazing dinner. Top three restaurants in the US!

Name: Del Posto
Comment: Just perfect

Name: Del Posto
Comment: I took my husband to DelPosto for his 56th birthday after seeing it being mentioned in a Daily News article as one of the best Italian restaurants and confirmation of same by a good friend.  The ambience, food, staff and service were all impeccable from the time we walked in the door until the time we left.  Such a romantic restaurant. Great for date night, birthdays and Valentine’s Day! We had the 5 course tasting menu.  Every dish was excellent even though our favorites were the linguine with geoduck, the shellfish stew, the branzino and the antipasti with sweet potatoes and pears!!!!  All delicious! The warm bread stick with the clotted cream and olive oil was addicting!  The whole team made our experience memorable especially Damiano and Jaziel! They didn’t miss a beat!! They even gave me a small foot stool to rest my handbag on so it wouldn’t be on the floor!!! Who does that???  We will definitely go back again!

Name: Del Posto
Comment: Del Posto is one of the most elegant restaurants I’ve ever been to. We did the Captains Menu where you tell the waiter your preferences and he selects the 8 courses. Every course was delicious. It was definitely pricey but well worth it for a special occasion.

Name: Del Posto
Comment: This is my all time favorite restaurant in the world.  I make sure when I travel to NYC that this place is on my dinner list.  That is a lot to say coming from an Irish guy from Chicago 😉

Name: Del Posto
Comment: This is one of the best restaurants around.  Quality of food and service is top notch.  You’re going to pay for it, but you won’t forget it.

Name: Del Posto
Comment: Excellent, elegant, extravagant, and extraordinary are just a few descriptive words to express how wonderful Del Posto is!

Name: Del Posto
Comment: Absolutely one of the most disappointing dinning experiences EVER. The ambience was dark, cold, sterile. Wait staff, though reasonably attentive was stiff and not friendly. Prices were exorbitant for vert average food e.g. $39 for a tossed salad, tuna entree ( 3 tiny medallions for as I recall $70)Would NEVER recommend to friends.

Name: Del Posto
Comment: Everything - food, service, decor, ambiance - was perfect.

Name: Del Posto
Comment: This just wasn’t good. Wasn’t worth the price. So much disappointment all around. It definitely lost its flare!

Name: Del Posto
Comment: Great Restaurant in every aspect. I feel it was better in prior years.

Name: Del Posto
Comment: Amazing food and service to match. Deep wine selection coupled with knowledgeable sommelier. Fabulous experience. Wowed the pants off our guests.

Name: Del Posto
Comment: The restaurant was beautiful but I expected much better with regard to the food, especially given the cost.

Name: Del Posto
Comment: Great space, great service, and exceptional food.  Perfect spot for a romantic date night.

Name: Del Posto
Comment: Del Posto is wonderful for lunch.  The prix fix is a great value for this fine dining restaurant.  The food and service were top notch.  It's lovely for a special occasion.

Name: Del Posto
Comment: Absolutely the most overrated Italian restaurant I have ever been too.  Beautiful with great service, but the food was subpar and outrageously expensive. $500 for two adults and a child.  We ordered two salads, two main dishes and one child’s pasta with three adult drinks. The main dishes and salad were bland. The child’s past was good though and my daughter loved the butter. Lol.  The largest portion on the menu was the butter.

Name: Del Posto
Comment: Outstanding service. A very enjoyable last evening in New York.

Name: Del Posto
Comment: New Year’s Day

Name: Del Posto
Comment: I had a high expectation. When I got there nice specious entrance and dining area. Service was good and attentive. Wine and salad was ok. But 2 pasta was unacceptably salty. I mentioned it. Then main dish Branzino was again salty. Tuna for my wife was as well. I don’t mind to pay 600.00 but not for this. Very disappointed.

Name: Del Posto
Comment: Family of 4 wearing jeans and sneakers seated in main dining room for New Years Eve Lunch. I recall once in the summer i was wearing a suit with dress sandals and not allowed to eat...No longer serving cocktails at the bar, only food service (the bar was empty) no one came to take drink order in the “ lounge” seating, decided to just go to tableLive piano music no longer at lunchSeveral dishes not up to previous standard, lasagna tasted like burnt tomato pasteLunch Prices raised.Bathroom towels and hand soap no longer superior.Table service excellent as alwaysAmbiance- stellar as always

Name: Del Posto
Comment: Best deal in NYC for a pre-fixe lunch....wonderful setting, superb service compliments what is a fantastic tasting lunch menu.  It's not inexpensive but it will be a memorable meal with one of the most extensive wine lists in the city.  Enjoy a classic Italian meal in a sophisticated and inviting setting.

Name: Del Posto
Comment: Most of the dishes were too salty.  I ordered waguy beef which was so tough.  The steak knife was so dull.  with the tough beef and the dull knife, it was not an enjoyable meal.  I have dined at Del Posto a few times in the past and I would not return again.

Name: Del Posto
Comment: Excellent service dining experience combined with an amazing meal and wine pairing experience We did 5 course tasting menu

Name: Del Posto
Comment: It was wonderful and one of the best meals ever!!

Name: Del Posto
Comment: The host should of been more welcoming. I had to interrupt them so we can be acknowledged. Everything after that was amazing. I will give them a second chance.

Name: Del Posto
Comment: Mike was a great host and server etc.

Name: Del Posto
Comment: My boyfriend and I had a fantastic experience dining at Del posto.I would definitely recommend this restaurant to my friends and family

Name: Del Posto
Comment: Incredible evening for a special occasion. Unique dishes, endless wine list and great atmosphere.

Name: Del Posto
Comment: Food was superb! Service was excellent! It was a bitter cold grey day that was warmed and brightened by the caring attention we received. We look forward to our next visit.

Name: Double Knot
Comment: Perfect in every way!

Name: Double Knot
Comment: Wow! My guest(s) and I couldn’t get enough of the Chef’s tasting menu until we were full. Definitely a special occasion/date night experience to be remembered.

Name: Double Knot
Comment: Exquisite sushi, robatayaki and other Japanese dishes, well plated with friendly but not obtrusive service. Would be very happy to return once it is safe to eat out again!

Name: Double Knot
Comment: Double Knot is situation in an intimate location downstairs from Sampan and the bar area.  Ambience is hip and a bit darker, so perfect for a date.  Noise wasn't too loud, so I could easily hear my date across from me.We did the tasting menu, which is excellent value at $60 given the amount of food we got (we had a lot of leftovers for more meals afterwards!).  The quality of the food was great as well and I'd definitely recommend this to others!

Name: Double Knot
Comment: I went to Double Knot with some colleagues and we not only found the food superb, but the service and ambiance were delightful as well. Great for girls night out, larger groups or sexy time with that special someone. Great vibe overall.

Name: Double Knot
Comment: Unfortunately, I found the food bland.  And while the ambiance and drinks were good, it wasn't worth the money.  I will not go back.

Name: Double Knot
Comment: This is our second time visiting and we love the atmosphere and the food.  Everything was great.  The service was outstanding and the food was delicious.

Name: Double Knot
Comment: It wasn’t clear that the bar reservation wasn’t eligible for happy hour specials

Name: Double Knot
Comment: This place is top 5 in Philly easy.

Name: Double Knot
Comment: Our second visit. really love everything about it. all the small plates so interesting. Evening menu has nine sections!  Incredible variety and assortment can be a bit overwhelming! First visit we did the tasting menu but this time we felt confident enough to order a la carte. Unfair to call it a sushi restaurant since it is much more than that. You may wish to peruse the menu online before you go. In the cold section we loved hamachi and avocado salad. I was not a fan of the king oyster mushroom but partner liked it. It's too rubbery for my taste.On the  "crispy" menu, the wings were wonderful. next time I'd like to try the Japanese fried chicken. We had the beef dumpling in broth that was delicious. My menu said beef soup dumplings which they are not. Partner's menu just said the correct "beef dumpling." Crab udon delish but not much crab. My favorite offerings at the restaurant are the Robotayaki especially the ribeye and Kobe beef. You may want to order double and triple of those. The lobster claw was also great. No room for dessert. Schulson does a great job with decor and fun experiences which enhance the whole experience and also manages to hire staff that are really friendly, professional and knowledgeable. They seem to be having fun even tho they are working.

Name: Double Knot
Comment: Dinning at Double Knot was definitely an experience. We had a reservation and ate at the counter downstairs. We had the chef’s tasting menu and they accommodated my shellfish allergy and it being lent. My one complaint is that we felt rushed and like we needed to eat as fast as possible. At one point we had four plates arrive at the same time.

Name: Double Knot
Comment: The upstairs bar area where you wait smelled horrible.  A mixture of bleach and feet.  Nearly left while waiting.  It’s not a good way to start and end the evening Food and service downstairs was excellent.  Sad that the experience was tainted

Name: Double Knot
Comment: This was our 3rd time coming to double knot and we enjoyed it just as the last one. I had the lovers knot cocktail which was amazing. Me and boyfriend ordered the Japanese fried chicken as something new to try. Flavour explosion in our mouths. It was the best thing ever.  Our waitress was Caydie and she was a sweetheart. Very informative on the items on the table and attentive to us.

Name: Double Knot
Comment: Service was excellent! Food was excellent except Brussels sprouts had too much balsamic vinegar.

Name: Double Knot
Comment: While the food was good, as always, this time we had a new server/bartender who didn't understand that soy is in all soy sauce. In fact, she argued with me about it until one of her colleagues that explained to her, very patiently, that soy, by the very nature of the thing, is made of fermented soybeans, and is not related to its gluten content. With my soy allergy, this is rather an important point. Still, she meant well, and other than this, we had a good time there.

Name: Double Knot
Comment: Omakase chef's tasting was delicious.  Server and female manager were rushing our table, clearing plates before we were done; the manager even took away my empty water glass after dessert without bringing it back (or refilling it). It was so obvious that they wanted to flip the table.  Unprofessional and not appreciated; our party of 3 spent $400 on dinner.

Name: Double Knot
Comment: best sushi place in town considering location ambiance and food!

Name: Double Knot
Comment: Happy hour was good cooked food apps are good  sushi was very meh.  Waitress was great.Would go back and only get cooked food.

Name: Double Knot
Comment: I forget our waiters name but he made the night with his wine and food recommendations.

Name: Double Knot
Comment: Excellent, as always! It’s on our rotation for business and pleasure!

Name: Double Knot
Comment: Omakase is a great way to go here - trust the chef.  Service was very helpful is selecting different beverages to pair with all the different courses

Name: Double Knot
Comment: On the pricey side but some of the best sushi I’ve had in quite some time.

Name: Double Knot
Comment: We love to come here. It’s a great date spot. The staff is very knowledgeable and attentive and they make great recommendations. We always order a bunch of dishes, and have the server recommend at least one of them so we try new dishes on each visit. Yum!!

Name: Double Knot
Comment: Six of us went to Double Knot at the recommendation of a friend while we were in town for the Flower Show.  It was a fabulous and fun dining experience!  Our waiter, Manny, walked us through the menu since it was our first visit.Everything we ordered was delicious from the Edamame Dumplings to the skewered  Octopus.  The tapas menu allowed us to try many different menu items and everything was great!

Name: Double Knot
Comment: Awesome dinner! We did the Chef’s Tasting menu and each course was better than the last. Cocktails were great, food was amazing, service was top notch.

Name: Double Knot
Comment: Went here for my boyfriend’s birthday. We did the chefs blind tasting menu along with a few extra courses of sushi and a couple round of cocktails. Everything from the drinks to the multiple courses were amazing. Our server was very informative and every clean plate was almost instantly cleared from our table. I must recommend: octopus sushi, duck scrapple, any robitiaki item, and their mochi ice cream. Overall, it was a great experience for a special occasion

Name: Double Knot
Comment: Our server was great at providing recommendations based on our preferences!

Name: Double Knot
Comment: Definitely my new favorite date night spot! We decided to order A La Carte instead of the chefs tasting menu and everything was amazing. Everything was prepared fresh and deliciously. Will definitely be returning!

Name: Double Knot
Comment: Always enjoy our time at Double Knot! Service is top-notch, the downstairs area is great for a date night, and the food is spectacular. We did the tasting menu and chose our selections. Everything was delicious and it let us try things we wouldn’t normally order. Food came promptly as it was ready, and, as fast eaters, we appreciated the pace. I believe the portions were smaller with the tasting menu but we did not leave hungry. We sat at the bar and the bartender was super helpful and patient as we made our decisions. One male bartender was a bit loud and I heard him complaining a bit, but other than that, we very much enjoyed the whole experience. Definitely a place for a special occasion or to take visitors!

Name: Double Knot
Comment: Great food but was way too dark inside

Name: Double Knot
Comment: Exceptional! We had the special menu and were extremely pleased! The cool vibe and original design, the impeccable service, and the whole experience make this our regular go-to in Philadelphia. The hard part is getting the reservation.

Name: Double Knot
Comment: It was good! Pricy but good!

Name: Double Knot
Comment: Excellent staff excellent food

Name: Double Knot
Comment: Everything was amazing. The attention to detail was great as well. Was worried about our seats at the counter downstairs but it was cool seeing the cooks do their thing behind the counter. The sushi quality was some of the best I’ve had in a long time. Definitely looking forward to coming back again.

Name: Double Knot
Comment: Carissa was amazing at the sushi counter. Was disappointed to have made a reservation to get there and wait for 10 minutes to not have a table ready. The food is superb so that was the least of our worries.

Name: Double Knot
Comment: Excellent food, good service

Name: Double Knot
Comment: Happy hour upstairs was fantastic!  Delicious choices from the HH menu, but also had to have an order of the tuna rice crackers from the regular menu.  Brussels sprouts are so good, we ended up ordering two!  YUMMY!  (Only thing we were not crazy about was the “roasted” broccoli, which seemed steamed. ) Great dinner before a show at the Academy!

Name: Double Knot
Comment: Always a great overall experience

Name: Double Knot
Comment: The service is top notch along with the stunning atmosphere. They really make you feel like you’re in an old speak easy. We did the chefs tasting which was fabulous. Definitely can’t wait to go back.

Name: Double Knot
Comment: I just cannot say enough about Double Knot - reserve a table and do the Chef's blind tasting - you will NOT be disappointed.   Service was superb! Ambiance great!

Name: Fishing With Dynamite
Comment: Such a great experience!  Fabulous cocktails and delicious oysters and Peruvian scallops!  We had the hamachi too which was perfection with a little touch of heat!!

Name: Fishing With Dynamite
Comment: My husband and I celebrated our anniversary here. Everything was great and Kacey took exceptional care of us!

Name: Fishing With Dynamite
Comment: I wish I hadn't taken so long to try this place! The seafood was spectacular - so fresh! And the drinks were heaven.

Name: Fishing With Dynamite
Comment: Great raw food. I know it's weird right now, but please for the love of god clear dirty dishes before dropping more food onto an overcrowded table then make us wait awkwardly for two minutes for someone to clear while food is sitting.

Name: Fishing With Dynamite
Comment: Always great loved the oysters and crab platters as well as the hamachi. And there social distancing and cleanliness was spot on.

Name: Fishing With Dynamite
Comment: Our first outing post-lockdown so everything is weird. We sat on the patio, which is really the street, and there is not much separation from the people on the sidewalk. But the food is as good as ever and service was attentive and unhurried. We will be back, even with our masks.

Name: Fishing With Dynamite
Comment: Excellent food and service.  Everything was executed perfectly.  Alice, the chef, is every bit as friendly and sweet as she is magnificent in the kitchen.

Name: Fishing With Dynamite
Comment: Awesome service. Great food.

Name: Fishing With Dynamite
Comment: We had a great date night, the staff was wonderful the food was even better than we hoped.

Name: Fishing With Dynamite
Comment: It was great to finally experience this sister restaurant to MB Post, which is just next door. As the name suggests, the cuisine is seafood oriented, which was fresh and delicious with influences from around the world and domestically.  We ate the grilled octopus, soft shell crab, and lobstah roll.  All were delicious, but we thought the stand-out item was the soft shell crab, which kind of looked like a spider roll meets brioche bun.  Lobstah roll only comes cold, and was tasty.  I prefer it hot, but not many restaurants prepare it that way. We were seated at the high top sushi counter, which was a nice location, but would be nice to try the new al fresco dining option next time, which is reclaimed street parking.

Name: Fishing With Dynamite
Comment: Kitchen was out of crab and other seafood no special rolls-   Did not tell us when we sat down did not tell us when we ordered. Came out later and said oops  -  really disappointing  Father’s Day surprises.

Name: Fishing With Dynamite
Comment: Awesome. Best seafood in the South Bay and one of the Top 3 seafood restaurants in all of LA County

Name: Fishing With Dynamite
Comment: Always fabulous! Best raw seafood in Los Angeles.

Name: Fishing With Dynamite
Comment: Wait staff was great.  We made a reservation and table wasn’t ready for about 10 mins, but they felt bad about that and brought out a few oysters and a round of cocktails, on them! We sat outside and they moved heater for me as soon as I asked.  Octopus appetizer and crab cakes were incredible! Highly recommend! Also had the halibut entree, but didn’t like the tomato corn salad, we didn’t finish it, unfortunately.  Other than that, atmosphere, service, aesthetics were all great.  Recommend!

Name: Fishing With Dynamite
Comment: So good we will be back again soon!!!

Name: Fishing With Dynamite
Comment: Delicious as always!! Thank you!

Name: Fishing With Dynamite
Comment: My friend was concerned about her first dine-in meal during the COVID-19 pandemic, so the restaurant seated us in a less busy corner of the restaurant (that was really nice of them).   The service people were very nice, and wore masks and gloves.  The seafood was very fresh, and the lobster sandwich was delicious.   I highly recommend the bread pudding for dessert.

Name: Fishing With Dynamite
Comment: Amazing food and cocktails!!

Name: Fishing With Dynamite
Comment: Love the outdoor tables!

Name: Fishing With Dynamite
Comment: Had a fantastic meal at FWD and the service was safe, thoughtful, and well done.  We loved every item on the menu and can’t wait to go back! Raw bar is amazing!!!!

Name: Fishing With Dynamite
Comment: Our table took 1 hour to free up (we had an 8pm reservation and weren't seated at our table until 9pm), but I appreciate that we were compensated with scallops and a tostada on the house. The manager handled it very well.

Name: Fishing With Dynamite
Comment: We enjoyed a lovely “social distancing” dinner the other night. The staff went out of their way to accommodate us and even offered a delicious complimentary appetizer while we waited for our table. The food is unbelievably fresh and delicious even though the menu is limited right now, we had no problem finding a variety of delicious options. The cocktails were inventive and the wine selection is carefully curated. Staff is friendly and knowledgeable and chef Alice makes a point to come out to greet the patrons. There is a reason FWD is such a favorite spot. It is well worth the advance reservation and the wait, if it comes to that.

Name: Fishing With Dynamite
Comment: Love FWD. Fresh seafood, great cocktails, great service.

Name: Fishing With Dynamite
Comment: Staff was incredible from Caroline to Jack and our waiter. Great experience!

Name: Fishing With Dynamite
Comment: Service could have been better. Restaurant was half full and it took a while to get drinks. Had to ask for new sets of new silverware three times.

Name: Fishing With Dynamite
Comment: So good! Amazing and passionate staff - over the top culinary creations. Don’t miss it ! And a super friendly chef.. destined for continued success. Try the craft cocktails!

Name: Fishing With Dynamite
Comment: Food is amazing - it’s small and claustrophobic, but worth it :).

Name: Fishing With Dynamite
Comment: Was absolutely incredible.  One of the best meals I have ever had.

Name: Fishing With Dynamite
Comment: Great raw platter and steams king crab!

Name: Fishing With Dynamite
Comment: Quality of service and food was excellent

Name: Fishing With Dynamite
Comment: Great small spot in Manhattan Beach. Everything on the menu was great. From the fries and mayo to the ceviche to the rice. Great bartender and cocktails too. Will definitely be back!

Name: Fishing With Dynamite
Comment: Good place ! Great location. When we were there, it was very busy. So service was slow. But, the bartender /waiter was awesome. He explained which oysters there were and the sauces. Just an excellent place. Oh, and the hostess was great too.

Name: Fishing With Dynamite
Comment: You will not find this menu at many restaurants.  Really caters to the shellfish / seafood lover. The variety is great without sacrificing quality. Oyster fans will find it hard to say there is a better place than this. The raw scallops are great as well. people talk about having the best clam chowder but I've never seen it prepared this fresh and tasteful. Great food and great value all around.

Name: Fishing With Dynamite
Comment: Love seafood! Fishing with dynamite serves up the best! Oysters , amazing, scallops, sensational. Excellent wine and I’m in heaven. Have mother but good words about this restaurant. Highly recommend!

Name: Fishing With Dynamite
Comment: THE place to eat in Manhattan Beach. Get whatever the server recommends

Name: Fishing With Dynamite
Comment: Amazing food

Name: Fishing With Dynamite
Comment: What a meal! Kenneth the bartender took great care of us and his oyster recommendations were spot on. #BrineBombThe hamachi is always a must and we loved the Spot Prawns, which are a seasonal treat.

Name: Fishing With Dynamite
Comment: The service is always outstanding!  The food is simply delicious.  One of Our favorite restaurant in MB!

Name: Fishing With Dynamite
Comment: Great spot. Will be back

Name: Fishing With Dynamite
Comment: Fresh seafood with nice flavors and very interesting souces

Name: Frances
Comment: Delicious food in a lovely, intimate environment.

Name: Frances
Comment: We got the tasting menu for $65 per person, best value!  Each dish unique and with many layers that complimented each other in the dish - 8 different plates that each stood on its own!

Name: Frances
Comment: Great service, and one of our dishes was outstanding, but overall the food quality did not match up with the high prices.

Name: Frances
Comment: Simply the best! Frances always delivers.

Name: Frances
Comment: Very friendly service. Always love the bacon fritters. I had a delicious fresh little gem salad with crab and a cauliflower soup with date purée.  Delicious.

Name: Frances
Comment: Frances never disappoints, one of my favorite places in the city for a nice date night. The house wine was great, and make sure you save room for dessert!

Name: Frances
Comment: First time at Frances and we'll be returning! The food was flavorful and delicious. The service was warm and knowledgeable, and the ambiance was cozy.

Name: Frances
Comment: After coming to Frances for over 8 years--typically for my birthday or my partner's birthday--I've never been able to get the coveted window seat...until the 22nd! We got lucky. Stars aligned.  We ate family style which was a value for us and our friends who eat smaller portions. And did I tell you the service was extra special? It was.

Name: Frances
Comment: Amazing, definitely will return.

Name: Frances
Comment: Love this place.

Name: Frances
Comment: Had been here before and it was amazing.  This time the food was good, but the server was dismissive and not very nice.

Name: Frances
Comment: We always love going to Frances.  It’s our favorite casual restaurant in the Bay Area.  Frances never lets us down, and actually seems even better every time we go there!

Name: Frances
Comment: Still lovely spot with excellent food and service. Definitely get the lumber jack cake!

Name: Frances
Comment: lovely intimate cozy restaurant with quality ingredients and nice portions.

Name: Frances
Comment: Perfect— great food and friendly service — and we went for Valentine’s Day— which can often be a tough night for restaurants.  But Frances pulled it off perfectly!  We always particularly like to sit side-by-side at the spot right next to the window— fun to watch the world go by.

Name: Frances
Comment: Frances continues to be my favorite restaurant in the city and one of my boyfriend's favorites as well.  Between the carefully curated menu and wine list, and the neighborhood feel of the venue, it was perfect for Valentine's Day dinner this year.

Name: Frances
Comment: My favorite restaurant in the city. From the quality of food to the cost, it is my favorite spot.

Name: Frances
Comment: Options for vegetarian and vegan food were not plentiful and not great. Ended up not eating entree-not special at all. Good wine list. Somewhat inattentive staff, by the time they asked if my food was okay or if I wanted something else, it was time to leave. Disappointing anniversary experience-not what I remembered in the past

Name: Frances
Comment: excellent service! love everything!

Name: Frances
Comment: We had the nicest person helping us! Food was delicious and ambiance was so perfect.

Name: Frances
Comment: Frances is always a terrific experience.

Name: Frances
Comment: Everything about this meal was special.   The wait staff was very friendly, helpful,  & attentive. The food was beautifully presented and expertly crafted by chefs who clearly know their ingredients & love what they do. Although it's a bit off the beaten path it's well worth the effort to get to this hidden gem.

Name: Frances
Comment: Excellent service, food, wine - looking forward to returning!

Name: Frances
Comment: Chickpea fritters and bacon beignets with dips were amazing! Housemade bread and lumperjack cake are also not to be missed. Our server was very attentive and easy to talk to. Do the tasting menu so you don't need to make an decisions becuase it's impossible to anyway ;) Everything is outstanding!

Name: Frances
Comment: The overall dining quality hasn’t changed. We’ve dined there since it’s opening and the food and wine choices plus preparation remain top drawer in SF. The service excels: the wait staff is warm but discretionary, and knowledgeable about the menu preparation and wine list. The diners are a good representation of the City, while still retaining its neighborhood feel. Still, the standout  food is the star!

Name: Frances
Comment: Frances is the perfect spot to start an evening out to the theatre, symphony, ballet or opera. The skilled and thoughtful staff will work with you to get you on your way on time. The fun, vintage F-Market trams are only steps out the door that take you on a nostalgic ride down market to your entertainment destination. Every dish that came out of the kitchen was perfectly prepared. Hint: order an appetizer or two, and a couple of side dishes, instead of an entre.

Name: Frances
Comment: We hadn't been to Frances for a while but we are SO happy that we returned last week for this very special dinner. Everyone was very welcoming and gracious and the food was amazing!We will be returning soon and often!!

Name: Frances
Comment: I love everything about Frances.  Tasting menu was an incredible value and I left stuffed.

Name: Frances
Comment: Wonderful restaurant.  Would highly recommend.  Not particularly child friendly but I took my 7 year old daughter  (it was my birthday dinner).  She is well behaved...not loud, anything like that.  I had never been there, it is a very small and you are very close to the other tables (the staff literally pulls the table out for you to get in the booth seat against the wall).   The staff was very kind and did nothing that wasn't "child friendly".  But, if I had known the ambiance of the place, I probably wouldn't have brought her.

Name: Frances
Comment: The hostess told us our table was needed for another reservation before we got to dessert. It was really, really disappointed.

Name: Frances
Comment: Love the food, the staff and atmosphere. Such a gem.

Name: Frances
Comment: Frances is back on top form. We shared a variety of bouchées and small plates. The favorites (smoked bacon beignets and the chick pea fries) were still outstanding - the beet side accompanying the chick pea fries could have had fuller flavor. The sour dough bread was very tasty. The brussel sprouts with tahini sauce were tangy and delicious and the pasta excellent. The only miss was the grits-consistency polenta - I would have preferred something less runny. Service was quick, friendly, and attentive.

Name: Frances
Comment: Lovely dinner, delicious food, attentive staff, a very enjoyable first time experience at Frances.

Name: Frances
Comment: The food was delicious and the service was great. Highly recommend this place 👍

Name: Frances
Comment: A continuous favorite with exceptional, small, curated menu and amazing team both in/outside the kitchen.

Name: Frances
Comment: Our favorite special-occasion restaurant, the vegetarian main-courses are great, and the music is always great too.  Small and cozy and not too loud.

Name: Frances
Comment: Always satisfying, high quality, comfort food.  Ample quantities.  Fixed price chefs menu is an excellent value.  Professional staff.

Name: Frances
Comment: Excellent food, great service.  A great treat.

Name: Frances
Comment: Magical as always!  Such a special place to dine in San Francisco.

Name: Frances
Comment: The sampler menu is great.

Name: Gabriel Kreuther
Comment: Great. But have more attentive waiters. Improve coffee making. In total, I had a great experience with my boyfriend.

Name: Gabriel Kreuther
Comment: Very  nice restaurant, amazing food and service but , very very expensive.

Name: Gabriel Kreuther
Comment: We selected the six course tasting menu. There wasn’t one dish that was disappointing. This is easily the most refined cuisine I have experienced in NYC and is probably in a class with some of the top restaurants in the world. Good luck in these turbulent times.

Name: Gabriel Kreuther
Comment: We had eaten at Gabriel Kreuther before and the food and experience this time was excellent. We will be back!

Name: Gabriel Kreuther
Comment: This was a surprise birthday dinner at Gabriel Kreuther.  It was a Monday night and tables were at 30% (perhaps due to the coronavirus?)  There was sophisticated jazz piped in and low decibel level.  The plethora of staff was professional from greet to exit.  GK has two tasting menus: nine course Heritage at $195 and the nine course Chef's Carte Blanche at $245.  While the restaurant recommends you allow 2 hours for the Heritage and 3 hours for the Chef's Carte Blanche, the prior lasted 2:35.   Do not be fooled by the food : time - we left quite satisfied by the portions.It was an amazing dining experience with our favorites being an early course Pistachio encrusted Foie Gras and the Grilled Dock to Dish Tilefish.  Choose from Grilled Berkshire Pork Culotte or Aged Long Island Duck Breast Smoked in Hay as your meat entree.Cocktails of various categories consistent with neighboring Bryant Park range from non-alcoholic, to classics, and signatures.  Pours of wine by the glass were short.As a nice touch, we were presented with a printed menu of the day on exit.

Name: Gabriel Kreuther
Comment: I prefer to relay my experience at a later date via email.

Name: Gabriel Kreuther
Comment: I've been to GK several times both in the main dining room and lounge.  Both experiences are always special and a cut above other high end restaurants.  We love coming back.

Name: Gabriel Kreuther
Comment: I picked the Heritage menu and it was incredible. Foie gras Terrine, pasta with truffle, caviar mousseline and tenderloin were to die for. Wine pairing was very good, it didn’t blow my mind (except for a surprising German Riesling and a phenomenal Chateauneuve du pape) but went very well with food. Price in line with the quality and the Michelin stars, very high but worth it.

Name: Gabriel Kreuther
Comment: Delicious and creative food , superb service but very noisy.

Name: Gabriel Kreuther
Comment: 2 Michelin quality food, service, ambiance, cadre... Perfect for business lunch, ideal for romantic dinner or dinner with friends. Amongst my fav restos in NYC.

Name: Gabriel Kreuther
Comment: What a special and wonderful experience!!!  The chefs came out to meet us and the service at every level was outstanding!!!

Name: Gabriel Kreuther
Comment: It's an incredible space with outstanding food, and exemplary staff. I would wholeheartedly recommend this fantastic restaurant!

Name: Gabriel Kreuther
Comment: Great experience!

Name: Gabriel Kreuther
Comment: This is a one-of-a-kind experience.  From the moment we walked in and checked our coats until we left - there was not one misstep.  The room is lovely, understated, with a nice bar for a pre-dinner drink.  The service was impeccable.  We had the Long Island duck breast and all the many courses that came before it (loved the langoustine tartar and fois gras) and then the sorbet that followed.  A really lovely touch is the little box of chocolates that you get on your way home!  Yes it is expensive - but s worth it!

Name: Gabriel Kreuther
Comment: Wonderful preparation tasting menu but problems out front. Wine service late with courses. Near end help was leaving and transition left us temporarily forgotten.

Name: Gabriel Kreuther
Comment: One of the most elegant and incredible dining experiences in New York.

Name: Gabriel Kreuther
Comment: We had a lovely romantic dinner. It was our first time trying out a tasting menu and had the best dining experience.  From the moment we walked into the restaurant, we felt welcomed. The service was exceptional. My partner has a shell-fish allergy, and our server was attentive and accomodating to his dietary restrictions. I was impressed with the plating and overall presentation of each of our dishes. The ambiance was romantic and lovely. Overall, it was an incredible experience and can't wait for the next time!

Name: Gabriel Kreuther
Comment: One of the best meals I ever had!

Name: Gabriel Kreuther
Comment: Amazing flavors and great wine pairing !!

Name: Gabriel Kreuther
Comment: One of very best restaurants in the US.

Name: Gabriel Kreuther
Comment: we were surprised that the service neither did ask if we would like to order a 2nd bottle of wine nor if we would like to have Cafe or Espresso to 'conclude' our dinner.

Name: Gabriel Kreuther
Comment: Amazing dinner. A sensory adventure. Every bite makes you feel more alive. All beautifully, meticulously presented in a welcoming atmosphere.

Name: Gabriel Kreuther
Comment: amazing plating with equally amazing taste. Impeccable service with an amazing dining experience make this a truly delightful place for all occation.

Name: Gabriel Kreuther
Comment: We ate at lunchtime.  Everything worked well.  However it appeared that the smoothnessdid not conceal the obvious comparison of LeBernadin--same price, both have excellentwine lists. Food good but not exceptional--and cost-cutting was obvious.  One kind of senses that Gabriel Kreuther will be closing soon. Definitely not in LeBernardin's class forservice, atmosphere and food.

Name: Gabriel Kreuther
Comment: Let me get right to the point - this was a very disappointing experience for us. For the amount we paid for this “special Valentine’s dinner” (we were celebrating my husband’s birthday), the 7- course menu (excluding the amuse bouche and petit fours) was “just ok”. I didn’t want to use mediocre to describe it, as there were some fantastic elements like the Dry aged duck and red apple consommé en gelèe.  Everything else fell flat in my opinion. I just didn’t think it was worth that kind of money. For a very steep price tag of $1K, every bite should’ve elicited a “wow!”, but it didn’t. Not to mention from a Michelin rated restaurant at that. To add insult to injury, our server announced at the start of dinner that they have added a dish to their menu which is Risotto and black truffle for an additional $50 pp. We declined, as we’ve anticipated a wonderful evening ahead of us. We couldn’t have been more wrong.  Spend your hard-earned money elsewhere. Per Se, Jean Georges, and Le Bernardin would be considered reasonable compared to GK, with amazing food to boot. Alinea in Chicago is very much worth the price tag - from start to finish. You would leave on cloud 9 and have the fondest experience ever ( we still dream about it to this day). And if you are ever in Oslo, Maeemo is top notch.  We will not come back.

Name: Gabriel Kreuther
Comment: Exception food, wonderful ambience, terrific service.  Couldn't have been better!

Name: Gabriel Kreuther
Comment: Amazing !!! Nothing else to say ! Couldn't be better.

Name: Gabriel Kreuther
Comment: Not enough foodA tasting sit down should not last 4 hours Left the restaurant very hungry For what I paid for dinner 1,300 all of the above comments should of been addressed Portions were extremely small only to have to wait a minimum of 30 minutes between each course.If your are to charge these prides, all of these issues should of already been addressed.Overall, the salvaging grace was that the food although  not sufficient was in fact very good.Dissatisfied customers should have an reinvite to correct the wrong with some type of a courtesy reduction in order not to lose a patron.Dr. Malpeso,

Name: Gabriel Kreuther
Comment: Our trip was

Name: Gabriel Kreuther
Comment: Excellent food and service - what more can you ask.

Name: Gabriel Kreuther
Comment: The food and service were outstanding. The setting was lovely: a subdued, pleasant ambience that allowed for quiet diner conversations.However, as with many high-end restaurants, the portions were very small. Certainly not satisfying for anyone with a hearty appetite.

Name: Gabriel Kreuther
Comment: Good but too expensive compare to similar fine dining restaurantes.

Name: Gabriel Kreuther
Comment: Second time here in the last year. Not to be missed when in NYC.

Name: Gabriel Kreuther
Comment: Let’s start with the fact that the restaurant was virtually empty, but once I received the check and saw that my guest had two scotches at $50each, it started to click. This restaurant has some brilliant moments of epicurean magic, and the wait staff is superb, but the expense relative to the actual food and wine is ridiculous. We ordered on the low end of the wine spectrum and it was still $500/ person. This is absurd and nothing about the dinner was remotely memorable.This was my third and last time dining here.

Name: Gabriel Kreuther
Comment: Quite an excellent meal. The main dining room only has a multi course price fixed meal so make sure you leave enough time or eat in the bar area.

Name: Gabriel Kreuther
Comment: Fantastic as always

Name: Gabriel Kreuther
Comment: It was a dining experience.  It was expensive, but you don't go to a place like this without expecting to spend.  It was lovely all around.

Name: Gabriel Kreuther
Comment: My first time at this restaurant. It was absolutely fantastic! From staff, who accommodated us in the dining room but with lounge menu option ( we were in a rush for the show), thru meals and desert. Food was incredibly tasty, well prepared, fresh ingredients, fantastic combinations of flavors! Really really liked it. Ordered tuna tartar, sturgeon appetizers, beef filet mignon, sea bass, chocolate desert... super delicious!Super pricey. We really enjoy our dinner. Thank you.

Name: Gabriel Kreuther
Comment: This place was as good as it gets.  The food was incredible and service stellar.  My mom took me for my 60th birthday.  We had the 9 course tasting menu and walked out in awe of the whole experience.  Definitely will be back.

Name: Gabriel Kreuther
Comment: This was my third visit and it was by far the best.  We chose the Chef's Carte Blanche menu.  We had an 8:00 reservation and time was not an issue.   If you choose this menu, be aware it can take more than four hours, which may be too long for some.  We felt every course was exquisite and the service impeccable.

Name: Geronimo
Comment: We had a lovely dinner!!  Delicious food with beautiful presentation.  Highly recommend!

Name: Geronimo
Comment: Has been and will be our favorite in Santa Fe!

Name: Geronimo
Comment: Seriously one of the best restaurants I've ever been to.

Name: Geronimo
Comment: Great service, food and ambiance. Great for a special day.

Name: Geronimo
Comment: As always Geronimo's was excellent in every way.  We always treat ourselves to a lovely meal there whenever we go to Santa Fe and will continue to do so.

Name: Geronimo
Comment: Everything was spectacular. We celebrated a graduation with our sons and thoroughly enjoyed the evening. Food was incredible. Want to return very soon!

Name: Geronimo
Comment: The dining experience was a wonderfully welcome treat after months of lock down.  The staff took reasonable precautions to protect diners in these topsy turvy times.

Name: Geronimo
Comment: Everything on the menu is wonderful, but the service was unmatched. Such warm and attentive hospitality.

Name: Geronimo
Comment: Delicious food, great service. Definitely will be back.

Name: Geronimo
Comment: Spectacular way to break the monotony of sheltering in place. For our first meal out, the host and waitstaff welcome was genuine and memorable.

Name: Geronimo
Comment: Great meal as usual.  This is one of my wife and my favorite restaurants in the country.  We had six couples dine and without exception every aspect of the meal was outstanding.

Name: Geronimo
Comment: One of the best meals I have had. Impeccable service, fresh and excellent ingredients, perfect presentation. An exquisite dining experience

Name: Geronimo
Comment: Amazing! Best dining experience we’ve ever had. This place deserves all the awards. You must go here.

Name: Geronimo
Comment: Best meal we had in Santa Fe!

Name: Geronimo
Comment: The warmth and hospitality were obvious from the moment we arrived. The food was delicious and every course was just as pleasing as the next. This is my top dining recommendation for Santa Fe!

Name: Geronimo
Comment: We had a great dinner on the patio, we were greeted with champagne and attentive service. Dinner was delicious, drinks too! Highly recommend!

Name: Geronimo
Comment: Our entire evening was delightful. This was our first dining out experience since February 28. We felt welcomed and entirely safe. Our meal of Asian Pear Salad with those wonderful tiny grilled blue cheese sandwiches and the fabulous elk were as amazing as we remembered them being. Thank you for making our evening memorable.

Name: Geronimo
Comment: really one of the more memorable dining experiences among the many that I have had. The presentation of exceptional food along with just the perfect amount of very qualified service allows me to highly recommend Geronimo.

Name: Geronimo
Comment: I was very underwhelmed with Geronimo. Our waiter was great. The food was very average, bland, nothing special. Just expected a bit more from this restaurant.

Name: Geronimo
Comment: Only complaint I have is I requested something and the concierge told me to take care of it myself not good

Name: Geronimo
Comment: The atmosphere and service was great and so was the cauliflower soup. But our steak was undercooked and under seasoned which sucks when it’s a $60 steak. The lobster pasta was Kong’s lobster was good but the pasta was blan.

Name: Geronimo
Comment: This was one of the best dining experiences my wife and I have ever had.  We will definitely go back.  The food was superb, nice ambiance (outside on Canyon Road) and a great waiter.

Name: Geronimo
Comment: This is a great place for a special occasion. Food and service always five stars. Friendly, unpretentious staff. Great location in the City Different .

Name: Geronimo
Comment: Geronimo is Santa Fe's best restaurant, bar none. My wife and I have birthdays ten days apart, and we both chose Geronimo as where we wanted to celebrate. We also took our family there recently, and each time, the service was impeccable; friendly and just enough. The rooms are quiet and handsome, and the cuisine is flawlessly prepared. I consider myself a decent cook, and I always am impressed and delighted by the food. The miso seabass is fantastic, as is the elk. The starters always lead the way, being tasty and light, and their wine by the glass choices are excellent matches to the dishes. This restaurant has maintained its high standards for the ten years we've been in Santa Fe. Hard to do, but they have managed it. Kudos.

Name: Geronimo
Comment: For me, Geronimo is one of the best restaurants on the planet.  The old adobe provides a wonderful environment.  The service is exceptional...always.  And the meals are extraordinary.  This visit was no exception.  The Elk was prepared to perfection.  My wife loved the flavors blended together in the chicken and my daughter loved the gnocchi.  The Tiramisu and Banana Cream Pie were both excellent and plenty for the three of us.  Can't wait for next visit.

Name: Geronimo
Comment: Perfect dining experience. Our waitress was wonderful. The outdoor dining option is perfect during this pandemic time. The food was great!  Highly recommend this place.

Name: Geronimo
Comment: Miso sea bass the best!Refreshing summer beer & burrata salad! And Chris Harvey the best owner/host!

Name: Geronimo
Comment: Lovely, lovely evening. The lemon crepe is out of this world. Thank you.

Name: Geronimo
Comment: Geronimo’s is always spectacular! It has been such a great treat to have Such a beautiful meal during a very difficult time.

Name: Geronimo
Comment: Geronimo continues to provide our favorite dining experience in Santa Fe, and that is high praise in a city famous for it’s fine restaurants. The wait-staff is professional, knowledgeable and engaging. The food I excelled and the ambience lovely. Additionally, the wine list is superb. Don’t miss Geronimo!And book early.

Name: Geronimo
Comment: Absolutely amazing!!! We will certainly be back again!

Name: Geronimo
Comment: easily the best restaurant in Santa Fe.  Excellent service and fabulous preparation and presentation of food.  we will be back soon!

Name: Geronimo
Comment: Awesome as always!  This place is about as good as it gets.

Name: Geronimo
Comment: Phenomena birthday dinner!

Name: Geronimo
Comment: The prawns / massive shrimp were amazing, and the presentation was perfect.

Name: Geronimo
Comment: Simply outstanding cuisine and service, as always.

Name: Geronimo
Comment: We celebrated our anniversary at Geronimo.  My wife and I both had the elk tenderloin and split a Caesar salad.  Both were excellent and the service was both professional and friendly.  As far as we are concerned, Geronimo continues to be the best restaurant in New Mexico.  Already looking forward to our next visit.

Name: Geronimo
Comment: Beet & avocado salad, crab cakes, miso sea bass

Name: Geronimo
Comment: Reggie was great!

Name: Geronimo
Comment: Great job all around—food and service outstanding

Name: Girl & the Goat
Comment: Amazing! Food atmosphere and service alway spectacularðŸ˜Š

Name: Girl & the Goat
Comment: We were so lucky to dine in right before Chicagoâ€™s lock down! Definitely coming back!

Name: Girl & the Goat
Comment: Beyond pleased with the food and service... the unique flavor combinations are unmatched!!! Highly recommend this dining experience... goat empanadas!!! Enough said...

Name: Girl & the Goat
Comment: The server was amazing and really helped us understand the menu! He had amazing recommendations - we were not disappointed in anything that he helped us order! The service was the best Iâ€™ve experienced in a long time and not to mention the food was outstanding!! Highly highly recommend!!

Name: Girl & the Goat
Comment: Server at first was quite cold, but warmed up eventually :)Everything I had was outstanding, from drinks to desert !!!Will be back next time im in Chicago :)

Name: Girl & the Goat
Comment: Amazing everything. Staff food atmosphere could not be better. Great experience!

Name: Girl & the Goat
Comment: So incredibly good.  Unique dishes but not with things so far out there I didn't know what I was eating.  I can't wait to go back.  I will plan a trip to Chicago around when I can go to Girl & the Goat!

Name: Girl & the Goat
Comment: Everything I had was amazing.  Would definitely recommend to anyone.

Name: Girl & the Goat
Comment: AMAZINGGGGG EVERYTHING 10/10 holy moly I canâ€™t even believe how deliciously amazing that was

Name: Girl & the Goat
Comment: Great food and service! Will definitely be back

Name: Girl & the Goat
Comment: Great creative food made to share.  Good cocktails as well.  Highly recommended for all foodies!

Name: Girl & the Goat
Comment: Every bite was delicious and our waitress went above and beyond to make sure our anniversary was special. Loved it!

Name: Girl & the Goat
Comment: The meal was very delicious and server was nice and helpful.

Name: Girl & the Goat
Comment: We enjoyed dining at Girl and the Goat. Everything is served family style which made it really easy to taste many things. Fun and delicious!

Name: Girl & the Goat
Comment: Exciting,unusual and delicious food choices. What a wonderful experience!

Name: Girl & the Goat
Comment: Best dinner of my life!!

Name: Girl & the Goat
Comment: Phenomenal experience from the food to the service!

Name: Girl & the Goat
Comment: Great food and great drinks!

Name: Girl & the Goat
Comment: Food is good - not that great. The duck was really good. Goat was good too, but too unconventional and the flavors didnâ€™t work that well. Some dishes were good, none were exceptional. Kind of overhyped. Thereâ€™s better food all along that block.

Name: Girl & the Goat
Comment: definitely good to check out if you havenâ€™t been before. Went for a date night... I would go back again with some girlfriends and sit at the bar next time. A little noisy to have a discussion. The Pork shank and the green beans are awesome!

Name: Girl & the Goat
Comment: Great food. Great service. Will come back again soon

Name: Girl & the Goat
Comment: Drove into town a night early because we were able to get a reservation here and it did not disappoint!! Every dish we tried was phenomenal. The seating was a bit tight, and when our allotted reservation time was up staff began to hover, but for the people waiting, I appreciate that. Go for the food!! But don't go to linger beyond 2 hours ;)

Name: Girl & the Goat
Comment: We haven't had this much fun dining out in a very long time.  Girl & the Goat is an utterly delightful restaurant, especially if one gets to sit at the "chef's table" which overlooks the long counter of prep/grills/etc.  If you want to be able to watch all the prep and interact with the chefs, go early.  If you want to watch an eye-popping and frenzied ballet as the chefs create your dinner, go later in the evening.The waitpeople are personable, unhurried and offer excellent advice as they guide you through menu.And now to the food.  Inventive, unusual & most of all delicious.  Of the 6 varied dishes [veggie, fish & meat] plus dessert, we particularly enjoyed the duck tongue and the goat liver patÃ©.  Not a single misstep.   Thank you Girl & the Goat!

Name: Girl & the Goat
Comment: Fantastic food, one of the best restaurants Iâ€™ve ever had

Name: Girl & the Goat
Comment: Scrumptious as always!

Name: Girl & the Goat
Comment: delicious foods, recommendations, and ambience. highly recommend it. short ribs were the best!

Name: Girl & the Goat
Comment: Innovative and flavorful food that is beautifully presented.  Service was excellent.  We had the walleye tempura , chickpea fritters, goat empanada, and pierogis.  All were prepared with different combinations of veggies, fruit and spices.  Sourdough bread was fresh and tasty.  The goat cheese cheesecake with blood orange sorbet was exquisite and light.  One of the best restaurants Iâ€™ve ever eaten at.  Canâ€™t wait to return on my next trip to Chicago!

Name: Girl & the Goat
Comment: Fantastic food!!! So good.  Everyoneâ€™s needs to come here.

Name: Girl & the Goat
Comment: Excellent service, knowledgable waiter and great ambiance. Go hungry because you need to try a variety of dishes.   Their vegetable dishes are super satisfying.

Name: Girl & the Goat
Comment: We had a 5:30P reservation on Tuesday night and were lucky enough to get seated at one of the Chefâ€™s Table. We had the opportunity to watch Chef Izard expedite orders and the chefs in the kitchen. The chefs interacted with us as their workload allowed. It was an awesome experience for foodies. We ordered the bacon Gouda bread, kohlrabi salad, branzino, crispy short rib, and goat belly confit. The bread was good, but unnecessary if youâ€™re looking to save room and calories for other items on the menu. The kohlrabi salad was delicious! My non-veggie eating husband went back for seconds and thirds and named the dish his favorite of the meal. We highly recommend it. The Branzino was my favorite dish of the meal. The chef responsible for preparing the fish was stationed right in front of our table, so we got to see its preparation. Served whole, this dish may be intimidating to some, but the crispy skin, tender meat, and the crunchy farro paired with the sauce was the PERFECT bite. Another dish that we highly recommend. The crispy short ribs were perfectly crispy on outside and tender on the inside and were paired with grapefruit and avocado. The meal itself was delicious, but the dish itself wasnâ€™t our favorite- too citrus forward for our liking. The goat belly confit was paired with crab and a vanilla sauce, and a composed bite of that dish made me drop my fork and close my eyes. It was PERFECTION!! Chef Izard ordered us a mini portion of the green beans on the house, and they were delicious! The beans were so perfectly charred and paired with sliced cashew and a garlic sesame sauce. Neither of us are huge fans of green beans, but this dish challenged our opinion. Again, highly recommend. To finish the meal, we ordered the Carmel corn & malt balls. Our server mentioned that it was one of their most popular desserts, and it was truly delicious. There was an unique contrast between the luxurious ice cream and the crunchy corn. I cannot recommend this restaurant enough!

Name: Girl & the Goat
Comment: Second time here and still fantastic. The broccoli is amazing, don't miss it.

Name: Girl & the Goat
Comment: Celebrated my birthday here with a big group, and everyone had the best time! Service was great, food and drinks were amazing, everything went very smoothly! This place definitely lives up to the hype.

Name: Girl & the Goat
Comment: Awesome, incredible food

Name: Girl & the Goat
Comment: This is my third visit in seven years and the food is always top notch. We ate the Ora King Salmon Poke, Pig Face, Duck Tartare, Pork Shank, Escargot Ravioli, Apple Gjetost Pierogi and drank the Goat's Choice (Scotch, Beet Juice, Lime) and Don't Carrot All What You Think. We had the Gets Better with Sage and Fireside at the bar while waiting for the table; top notch drinks. The Ora King Salmon Poke was the most flavorful and impressive dish followed by the Duck and Pig Face. The Pork Shank was surprisingly over salted so we took it home to add some sugar for balance. We sat at a two seat, slim table behind a barrier to the people getting trashed at the bar. I understand the West Loop is getting more expensive with each Instagram-flex post and want to make use of each square footage, however, the restaurant should reconsider the layout of sitting a two person table near the super loud bar and kitchen area that will make any introverted foodie lose their enjoyment of food. Luckily, my significant other thoroughly enjoyed herself on her birthday even if the Girl and the Goat staff did not acknowledge her. Kudos to our bartender and servers for an enjoyable evening.

Name: Girl & the Goat
Comment: Overrated.  Expensive. Service was mediocre.  Interesting menu.

Name: Girl & the Goat
Comment: My daughters and her boyfriend.

Name: Girl & the Goat
Comment: Amazing food, excellent service!  Our party of 3 shared 8 plates including desserts. Impossible to pick a favorite!

Name: Girl & the Goat
Comment: Absolutely incredible small plates. Couldn't believe how good the Duck Tartare was.

Name: Girl & the Goat
Comment: Great experience. I recommend to every one that lives in our visitors

Name: Girl & the Goat
Comment: We had a very gracious, efficient, and accommodating server. The food was amazing and very delicious, especially the duck tongue and duck tartare.

Name: Giulia Restaurant
Comment: Was amazing! Such a fan of Giulia. Kinda, friendly serving staff. Amazing food. Lives up to the hype, and well worth the money.

Name: Giulia Restaurant
Comment: Really good dinner here our server was wonderful. Very knowledgeable about wines and the food. Gem of a place on Mass Avenue. We will go back.!

Name: Giulia Restaurant
Comment: Great food and service, thank you!!  Loved all the dishes and flavors. Noise level is a little high--maybe some sound mitigation?

Name: Giulia Restaurant
Comment: Really enjoyed my first and much anticipated visit to Giulia.  Everything was outstanding.  Had the signature pappardelle with wild boar with the fresh black truffle add on (such a treat!), veal pasta special, housemade sourdough, burrata with lentils (so good), live scallop ceviche with fermented muscat grapes (so so good), octopus and squid with chickpeas, and an excellent primitivo at the server's suggestion.  Pricey yes but not out of line with the quality/creativity of the meals.  The pasta was perfectly cooked.  Got a last minute res via open table.  Will def be back.

Name: Giulia Restaurant
Comment: The pasta here is not to be missed. Always try something new.

Name: Giulia Restaurant
Comment: Terrific small Italian great local food and friendly service

Name: Giulia Restaurant
Comment: Excellent food, wonderful service. It was worth a visit. Wouldn't say it's in my top 5 but definitely top 8. A word of warning - parking is TOUGH. If you can Uber or use public transport, do it.

Name: Giulia Restaurant
Comment: Hands down one of the best in Cambridge, if not Boston. Beats the north end by a mile. Tough to get a reservation at a normal hour, which is frustrating, but you’ll forget what time it is when you’re inside enjoying the incredible food. The menu seemed to be heavy on homemade pastas (which were amazing), so not sure if they have many gluten free options - though I didn’t ask.

Name: Giulia Restaurant
Comment: Amazing as usual! The top handmade pasta in MA. The bar sometimes has the best seats for interactive experience.

Name: Giulia Restaurant
Comment: Fabulous!!!

Name: Giulia Restaurant
Comment: Fantastic!!  Worth waiting for a reservation.

Name: Giulia Restaurant
Comment: Our waitress was incedible... she was extremely knowledgable with the wine list and her service to our table was awesome.. the food was some of the best we have ever had in a local restaurant.... would definitly return...

Name: Giulia Restaurant
Comment: It’s very deceptive.  The opening  photo of the restaurant on Open Table is NOT of Giulia Restaurant.  The atmosphere is quite pub like and not an elegant restaurant with white table clothes.The food was a B+ but not worth the cost.  Service was exceptional.

Name: Giulia Restaurant
Comment: The fixed price menu was not disclosed on opentable. This information is critical. Dinner was much more expensive than expected as a result

Name: Giulia Restaurant
Comment: This Has to be the most unwelcoming restaurant I have ever been to! If any of the bartenders smiled I’m quite sure their faces would’ve cracked! The food is good but I won’t go back because of the service. The ambience is not that great either and the chairs terribly uncomfortable.

Name: Giulia Restaurant
Comment: Extraordinary food, extraordinarily knowledgeable and helpful service.  An extraordinary dining experience.

Name: Giulia Restaurant
Comment: Reserve WAY in advance !  Food is fantastic, space intimate, wait staff friendly and knowledgeable.  Wine and drink selection excellent.

Name: Giulia Restaurant
Comment: Kerri was one of the best waiters I’ve ever had at any restaurant, highly recommend requesting her!

Name: Giulia Restaurant
Comment: Came for the pasta, but thought the apps were going to steal the show after having a taste. They didn't. The pasta was even better. Probably could have cut back on the salt by about 15-20%, but still one of the absolute best restaurants we've been to in Boston.

Name: Giulia Restaurant
Comment: First, everything was perfectly cooked ... to the point where the smoked octopus/squid was in my top 3 ever.  Our server was knowledgeable, friendly, and added to our overall experience.  We thought that, given the difficulty of getting 6 pm to 8 pm reservations, that the food would be more “memorable” .... undoubtedly an expectation that is somewhat unfair. I would return, but would limit myself to octopus and pasta,  the two strength areas, which would also keep the tab at a more reasonable level. Wines were delicious and worth the price ..... particularly liked the aglianico and nebbiolo.

Name: Giulia Restaurant
Comment: Wonderful as always!

Name: Giulia Restaurant
Comment: The food was off, rosemary in all the dishes, food salty and not edible/

Name: Giulia Restaurant
Comment: Fantastic appetizers and a bit too greasy and heavy entrees. Anyway that’s is the best restaurant in Boston (so far)

Name: Giulia Restaurant
Comment: What a wonderful restaurant! My boyfriend LOVED absolutely everything on their menu, and even though I have some dietary restrictions, our waitress kindly offered an adjusted dairy-free version of the dish I wanted. The starters, the mains and the desserts were delicious. It is one of our favorite spots in Boston, and we are definitely coming back there again!

Name: Giulia Restaurant
Comment: Excellent appetizer, entrees and dessert. Wine selection is great but expensive per glass. Great service. Difficult to get a table without reservations.

Name: Giulia Restaurant
Comment: This the second time we have eaten here and it did not disappoint. The drinks, food and service were amazing.

Name: Giulia Restaurant
Comment: Outstanding, as ever. My husband and I struggled to narrow down our choices of tempting offers and were helped by our terrific server to choose a pasta and the Branzino with some apps. That paired with cocktails and the trebbiano wine was the perfect meal. Guilia's always hits it out of the park!

Name: Giulia Restaurant
Comment: This was our third visit at the restaurant. The food quality is well above the North End Italian restaurant. I had the celery root gnocchi and it was very rich with seafood and the souse was very tasty. My spouse ordered the whole grilled branzino and this was a very generous portion and made very well. the sfizzi and antipasti portion on the other hand were relatively small. We will return.

Name: Giulia Restaurant
Comment: I wish the initial question above had an “insure” option.   The appetizer and antipasto options were great but I thought the main entrees or the secondi section had only one vegetarian option.  Also the wines understanding were all Italian wines but it would have been quite useful to have better descriptions to those less familiar with Italian wines.Also it was a bit of a tease to hear a one minute plus  description of the special entree only to discover the price of the dish was $65 inflated by the addition of truffles.

Name: Giulia Restaurant
Comment: New Years eve

Name: Giulia Restaurant
Comment: All our food was absolutely delicious! Our venison appetizer was so fresh and clean tasting. We both ordered pasta and I don’t know whose tastes better — they were both incredible. For dessert we got the chocolate terrine and the chocolate gelato was so creamy! Service was very attentive. Would definitely come back for other special occasions.

Name: Giulia Restaurant
Comment: Giulia has been on my list to try for awhile, as one of the top Italian restaurants in Greater Boston. It lives up to the hype. This was a pre-theater dinner for 2 couples. We tried the flatbread, scallops, and prosciutto appetizers all of which were terrific. Then we all ordered different pasta dishes. The pasts was all perfectly prepared, with interesting and complex flavors well-balanced. Desserts were also delicious.
