The only hiccup was when the kitchen missed our dessert order, and our server had to intervene to get desserts to us before we had to go to theater - in the end we were a little rushed. No big deal. We will definitely return, and Giulia is an excellent value!

Name: Giulia Restaurant
Comment: We finally got a reservation and were not disappointed! Service was great,  everyone warm, welcoming and funny.  Food from appys through dessert was awesome.  There is a reason this place is extremely hard to get a reservation. Don't let that stop you it's worth the effort. For those who like to eat at the bar, it's first come first served.

Name: Giulia Restaurant
Comment: I wanted to go for a very long time but the place is so "famous" that it only happened a couple days ago and it was definitively worth it!I do recommend!

Name: Giulia Restaurant
Comment: This place was incredible. I am not a fan of iyali3and they blew my mind away!! I already booked reservations again after the first app came out. Chicken liver crostini

Name: Giulia Restaurant
Comment: Generally Giulia lives up to its high reputation; among other points, it is an entirely successful Italian substitute for the sort of high-quality classic French cuisine that has more or less vanished from Boston in the last decade. Our octopus starter with Umbrian lentils was delicious, but outmatched both by the pasta and steak, both of which my partner and I shared. Although everything was done to perfection, the mushroom and kale elements in the pasta sauce and the aioli accompanying the steak were particularly superb. The selection of Italian wines by the glass was slightly narrow but excellent.In reviewing a restaurant of Giulia's quality, it is surely not churlish to cavil at minor slips. Prosecco was rather too close to room temperature. More seriously, the pudding selection was unambitious and strikingly Americanized: no proper Italian pastry was on offer, nor was a cheese option, which by definition requires comparatively little preparation. Nonetheless we found the evening entirely satisfying.

Name: Giulia Restaurant
Comment: Great food in a setting with a neighbourhood feel. Hard to understand menu but really good simple Italian food. Do ask if there are any off menu additions like truffles - unfortunately, my rather disinterested waiter failed to volunteer any information.

Name: Giulia Restaurant
Comment: Pasta can't be beat.  Amatriciana is perfect.  Wine recommendations always spot on.

Name: Giulia Restaurant
Comment: Amazing waiter and sommelier. We will go back.

Name: Giulia Restaurant
Comment: The three of us got 4 pastas to share and a glass of wine each for about $50 per person. Everything was perfectly delicious. We left happy and full

Name: Gramercy Tavern
Comment: Fantastic!

Name: Gramercy Tavern
Comment: We enjoyed our starters and desserts. Didnâ€™t love our main dish, chicken and veal

Name: Gramercy Tavern
Comment: Wonderful birthday dinner.  Exceptional food and service!

Name: Gramercy Tavern
Comment: We had a reservation in the main dining room and decided to do the seasonal tasting menu, one with the wine pairings, one without.All of the courses were varied, expertly prepared and delicious. We especially appreciated the spacing between courses, which allowed us to not only enjoy the flavor of each course, but also the overall ambience of the restaurant.The service was outstanding from beginning to end and they easily accommodated special requests.We highly recommend the Gramercy Tavern!

Name: Gramercy Tavern
Comment: One of the best there is.  Service is impeccable, unobtrusive, and extremely professional.

Name: Gramercy Tavern
Comment: This was one of mine and my husbands best dining experiences we have ever had. (And we have dined in some great places.) We would definitely return.

Name: Gramercy Tavern
Comment: One of our best fixed price meals ever!  The seasonal six course dinner was great!  And the service is the best of any restaurant!

Name: Gramercy Tavern
Comment: Good was just okay. Nothing special. Overall feels like a tourist restaurant that has seen better days.

Name: Gramercy Tavern
Comment: As good as advertised. Food is superb, service is outstanding, wine list is imaginative. Weâ€™ll be back.

Name: Gramercy Tavern
Comment: We ordered the lunch tasting menu with wine pairing at Gramercy Tavern. What a fantastic value! The amount of food and wine we received for the price (which already included tip) was impressive. The food was wonderfully prepared and presented and the staff were very flexible to accommodate dietary restrictions and make substitutions as necessary. For the price for the wine pairing (about $50 a person for 5 courses) we were expecting lower-end wines, but the wines were the same quality as that used for their much more expensive dinner wine pairings. I would definitely recommend going to Gramercy Tavern for lunch for a memorable meal at a great value.

Name: Gramercy Tavern
Comment: ðŸ¤— delightful indeed Thank you very muchChris

Name: Gramercy Tavern
Comment: Birthday lunch

Name: Gramercy Tavern
Comment: How Gramercy Tavern earned its reputation for good (or great) food is beyond me, my husband and our two dinner guests.  The chefs/cooks appear to have dumped nothing other than salt on all the food.  My entrÃ©e was so bad that it got sent back.  My appetizer (pasta with Bolognese sauce) was drowning in oil; it was disgusting.  At the end of the meal our waiter did the right thing; she took the cost of my dinner off the tab.  If someone gave me a gift certificate to this restaurant, it would be thrown in the trash.

Name: Gramercy Tavern
Comment: Great combinations on the tasting menu.  Look to return soon.

Name: Gramercy Tavern
Comment: The food was excellent and the staff was amazing, especially our server Toni who made our experience memorable and added her personal touch of hospitality.

Name: Gramercy Tavern
Comment: Way too expensive!

Name: Gramercy Tavern
Comment: The food was superb. The service was first rate and really attentive. The deserts were impeccable. Gramercy Tavern will remain in my fine dining rotation for many, many years to come!!

Name: Gramercy Tavern
Comment: Great choices on the menu. Outstanding service. The wine list is outstanding. Arrived early and had a drink at the bar. Very well organized as they transferred my bill and sat us easily.

Name: Gramercy Tavern
Comment: Reservation honoured 20 minutes late. Place was so busy that main courses were served a bit less than hot! Hostess was dour and overstressed. Could not handle the pressure!!

Name: Gramercy Tavern
Comment: After reading your cookbook and all of Mr. Myersâ€™ books I had been  so looking forward to GT and you lived up to and exceeded all expectations.  Our enthusiastic server was a delight!

Name: Gramercy Tavern
Comment: Our dinner experience at the Tavern's dinning area was nothing short of spectacular. The food was excellent, but even better was the service. I was there with my son and daughter celebrating her birthday. Our server made sure everyone was happy, he provided excellent recommendations and was very friendly. The food was fantastic and the dishes were both the right potion and executed to perfection. Would love to come here again.

Name: Gramercy Tavern
Comment: We came to celebrate my daughter, Meghan, birthday and  it was wonderful.  Carolyn, our waitress, was terrific.Thank you for making her birthday a treat.The Grosso Gals

Name: Gramercy Tavern
Comment: I particularly enjoyed the tasting menu at lunch.  Considering the reputation of the restaurant, it was up to expectations.  Interesting dishes at a reasonable cost for the kind of restaurant it is.  Excellent service, friendly and helpful in a comfortable setting.  We liked the idea of the no tipping policy.  We will return.

Name: Gramercy Tavern
Comment: Ridiculous mealâ€”out of sight amazing! Service was impeccable. Our favorite restaurant on our trip!

Name: Gramercy Tavern
Comment: Good food, beautiful presentation, but did not blow me away. For the price tag and the Michelin star, I was expecting more.

Name: Gramercy Tavern
Comment: This restaurant never disappoints. The dining room is staffed with lovely people who are attentive, kind and love the food they bring to you. And everything is delicious. This is cuisine in a great setting.

Name: Gramercy Tavern
Comment: We loved the atmosphere and beauty of Gramercy Tavern. The staff was friendly and genuine. The restaurant was beautiful and the food was just perfect.

Name: Gramercy Tavern
Comment: Great place to eat worker are super friendly and a great experience

Name: Gramercy Tavern
Comment: Second time here with my wife. Probably our best dining experience

Name: Gramercy Tavern
Comment: Just wonderful in all respects. Kelsey is a gem!Thanks to all for a great experience.

Name: Gramercy Tavern
Comment: Very welcoming. Lovely service and great food.

Name: Gramercy Tavern
Comment: Sad to report that after many years going to GT standards have dropped. The food was Average at best on the seasonal menu. The duck was hit but the portion size was tiny. The pasta was sausage and clams a complete miss quality you get at a bad diner. As mentioned portion size are so tiny that my kids left starving - which make it expensive given the 184 for the pre set dinner. Hopefully a one off miss.

Name: Gramercy Tavern
Comment: We had a most enjoyable late lunch. Everything we ordered was delicious including the relatively inexpensive market lunch menu and the complementary salad.

Name: Gramercy Tavern
Comment: Great lunch! Delicious food! Kind service!

Name: Gramercy Tavern
Comment: We are carnivores but look forward annually to the summer vegetable tasting menu.  Chef Michael Anthony is known for his prowess with vegetables.  The creativity and deliciousness of this tasting menu is testimony to his genius.   Not to be missed!

Name: Gramercy Tavern
Comment: Food and service was impeccable as always at Gramercy Tavern, however that level of expertise does come at a price! I like the "no tipping" policy, but was a little disappointed to find that the only options in the dining room were a three course or six course prix fixe menu. No a la carte options available. I'll be back at GT, next time might dine at the bar where there are more options.

Name: Gramercy Tavern
Comment: Still remains one of the best! Food is phenomenal and service is fantastic.

Name: Gramercy Tavern
Comment: The food was good (the chef likes it spicy), but ridiculously high prices for beer and wine by the glass, 3 - 5 Dollars more than Michelin three rosettes restaurant Le Bernadin; staff is strained, maybe because they do not get tips, that's why the prices for beverages are so high - they say.

Name: Gramercy Tavern
Comment: I loved my evening at Gramercy Tavern! The food was incredible, and the service was terrific. My only critique was the noise level, but considering the architecture and room size it wasn't surprising that it got a little loud. On the upside, the general cacophony covered the borderline pornographic sounds I made while eating the tilefish course!!

Name: Gramercy Tavern
Comment: Double birthday

Name: The Grill - The Ritz-Carlton, Naples
Comment: The last night they were serving food in Florida. What a beautiful way to eat our prior to quarantine. Filet mignon, mushrooms, luscious chocolate cake and the bread. So fortunate to enjoy a wonderful meal in such a surreal time. Stay safe, healthy, and well. Thank you the grill!

Name: The Grill - The Ritz-Carlton, Naples
Comment: The whole experience from the food to the wait staff was absolutely 5 star!! Scott is a true professional server and made my family and I feel very special! Hats off to the entire team at The Grill-Ritz Carlton Naples!!

Name: The Grill - The Ritz-Carlton, Naples
Comment: Not just exceptional, beyond five stars to the entire staffs, Cheft and facility!  Very grateful to have a place (Cheers fans)where everybody knows your name and glad that you came !

Name: The Grill - The Ritz-Carlton, Naples
Comment: We chose the Grill for our anniversary dinner and it was a wonderful experience from the moment we were greeted to when we left.  The service, food, and ambiance were great.  We were not rushed as we enjoyed our meal.  We ordered many dishes from recommendations from the server including the soufflé for dessert.  Everything was wonderful.

Name: The Grill - The Ritz-Carlton, Naples
Comment: Fantastic birthday dinner- our waiter Altemar was hysterical and wonderful!

Name: The Grill - The Ritz-Carlton, Naples
Comment: Staff is attentive and food is prepared with a special flair.

Name: The Grill - The Ritz-Carlton, Naples
Comment: Great spot for special occasions - pricey.  Nice presentation.

Name: The Grill - The Ritz-Carlton, Naples
Comment: The Ritz is a perfect end to our Sunday. Food is always wonderful and it is always lovely to see our friends at The Grill. They are all wonderful people whom we have come to know very well since our first visit.  The Grill is our No. 1 restaurant in town.

Name: The Grill - The Ritz-Carlton, Naples
Comment: Outstanding restaurant. Matt the server was terrific. Only complaint is the noise level.

Name: The Grill - The Ritz-Carlton, Naples
Comment: First of all we had the best waiter - ever!

Name: The Grill - The Ritz-Carlton, Naples
Comment: Cannot fault the excellent food and service.

Name: The Grill - The Ritz-Carlton, Naples
Comment: The server was excellent! I especially loved the artistic look of our desserts, and they were wonderful to eat!

Name: The Grill - The Ritz-Carlton, Naples
Comment: Good service, nice ambiance and a wonderful wine list when combined with quality food is always a winner! Nice job by the Ritz Carlton

Name: The Grill - The Ritz-Carlton, Naples
Comment: Food and service was great. Would highly reccomend.

Name: The Grill - The Ritz-Carlton, Naples
Comment: Birthday celebration, it was great.

Name: The Grill - The Ritz-Carlton, Naples
Comment: We had a beautiful birthday celebration in the Grill Room at the Ritz Carlton.  All the staff made our table feel special.  The meal was delicious from apps to souffle dessert.  Thank you Ritz for a very special birthday dinner!

Name: The Grill - The Ritz-Carlton, Naples
Comment: It was our annual stop, and the reason we keep coming back is that we are never disappointed from our high expectations. Can’t wait for next year.

Name: The Grill - The Ritz-Carlton, Naples
Comment: One of the finest dining experience in Every way!

Name: The Grill - The Ritz-Carlton, Naples
Comment: Amazing as always. David is the best waiter. We always ask for him

Name: The Grill - The Ritz-Carlton, Naples
Comment: amazing service and menu!!!

Name: The Grill - The Ritz-Carlton, Naples
Comment: Excellent food and service.

Name: The Grill - The Ritz-Carlton, Naples
Comment: I told the waiter three times that I didn't want the salmon MUSHY - it had to be prepared well-done,and it was served MUSHY!!!  I tried to explain but we got nowhere.  We were seated next to the kitchen, and it was very annoying.  We had an older couple with us, and they were equally distracted.  It was difficult to talk with all of the traffic.  We look forward to visiting this property when we are in Naples, and this visit was extremely disappointing.

Name: The Grill - The Ritz-Carlton, Naples
Comment: The meal was a huge disappointment.  Nothing was outstanding.  My Delmonico steak was tough - even though cooked to proper temperature.  Wedge salad was bitter and under dressed.  Rolls we just ok.  Foie Gras was marginal at best, not cooked properly and taste was off.  Sauturne wine offered with it was good.  For a $300 meal for two the very nice atmosphere did not make up for a marginal meal.  Would not recommend for the food.

Name: The Grill - The Ritz-Carlton, Naples
Comment: Wonderful service and food.

Name: The Grill - The Ritz-Carlton, Naples
Comment: All servers are outstanding and Lamar is an excellent wine sommelier

Name: The Grill - The Ritz-Carlton, Naples
Comment: The food,  drinks, service and ambiance were all terrific!   It will be our new “go to” spot in Naples.

Name: The Grill - The Ritz-Carlton, Naples
Comment: It was lovely to see all our friends at The Grill. Wonderful food as usual. Always our “go to” spot when in town.

Name: The Grill - The Ritz-Carlton, Naples
Comment: While everything was good, it was not great, primarily due to the side dishes.  Lobster mac and cheese nowhere near as good as Capital Grill and much smaller.  All sides are small (we also had creamed spinach and au grautins) and just not that good for the prices.  All steaks were very good and cooked to perfection.  Breads are good but should be served warmer.

Name: The Grill - The Ritz-Carlton, Naples
Comment: Excellent!

Name: The Grill - The Ritz-Carlton, Naples
Comment: food and service was great however the kitchen was extremely slow over 3 hour dinner too much time between salad and entree.

Name: The Grill - The Ritz-Carlton, Naples
Comment: Aldemar, our server was outstanding!!!Ritz very accommodating to my food allergies (gluten, lactose, preservatives)...which is saying a lot!Fabulous gluten free French fries, chocolate soufflé , foi gras.  Delmonico was disappointing but when I mentioned, taken off the bill!  Loved the Ceasar salad.  French fries done in separate oil to perfection!!!

Name: The Grill - The Ritz-Carlton, Naples
Comment: We arrived 20 minutes before our reservation and they seated us promptly. Unfortunately the table was in a busy traffic pattern for waiters and customers. My main course arrived cold, and it took them a long time for them to bring another replacement, and I was still eating after my husband was finished with his meal.  My food was delicious hot. Overall, we felt the waiters were not as attentive as previous visits. We saw other ladies receive a red rose  and small sampling of sweets, and we were over looked. Finally, when we were ready to leave, they finally brought it Felt like an afterthought......

Name: The Grill - The Ritz-Carlton, Naples
Comment: We were celebrating Valentine’s Day. This is our 3rd time there. It never disappoints.

Name: The Grill - The Ritz-Carlton, Naples
Comment: Excellent menu and very good wine list. Ambience is excellent and quiet enough for good conversation. As part of the Ritz-Carlton, the service was predictably superb.

Name: The Grill - The Ritz-Carlton, Naples
Comment: Overall good. Service was slow. Filet was warm and slightly over cooked. Ambiance excellent.

Name: The Grill - The Ritz-Carlton, Naples
Comment: Great service and an excellent menu and dinning experience. Highly recommended.

Name: The Grill - The Ritz-Carlton, Naples
Comment: This was our second year in a row at The Grill.  The space is pretty good for a hotel but the food is great and the service is exceptional.  Def. dine here if you are staying at the Ritz Carlton.

Name: The Grill - The Ritz-Carlton, Naples
Comment: Very elegant with delicious menu options,  The service was excellent, just as you would expect it to be at a Ritz Carlton.  I had the shrimp cocktail which was delicious, the shrimp were large and very tender.  My husband had the burrata which he said was very good.  We both had  the bronzino which was deliciously prepared.  We split a chocolate souffle, which came with hot chocolate and whipped creme to top the delicious chocolate with.  It was to die for.  Highly recommended if  you are a chocolate fan.  They had other souffle flavors  and you also could order them in a sampler with all three flavors.   A very delicious dinner in a very nice setting that we both enjoyed.  Highly recommend the Ritz Grill for a special dinner.

Name: The Grill - The Ritz-Carlton, Naples
Comment: We had an excellent and patient waiter named David. The service was very good. There  was follow up to make sure everything okay, even for more bread. It was a wonderful meal and made us feel special. Highly recommend this place for special event dining. Although not required a sport jacket was most common.

Name: The Grill - The Ritz-Carlton, Naples
Comment: Beautiful service , great food. nose bleed prices. Great venue for an anniversary

Name: Halls Chophouse
Comment: great steak house , elegant good wine list one of the best

Name: Halls Chophouse
Comment: Service was superb, food couldn’t have been better, value was exactly what you should get

Name: Halls Chophouse
Comment: Great location! Exceptional food and service. This place is must visit if in Charleston.

Name: Halls Chophouse
Comment: Best in Charleston and maybe in the USA. Food-Service Perfection

Name: Halls Chophouse
Comment: We decided to try Halls for dinner since everyone said it was so good and man it was AMAZING!! I would definitely come back to this restaurant and recommend it to everyone. The filet was awesome and the best side was the creamed corn! I got the Filet over mushroom risotto. Everyone that was with us enjoyed their meal and did nothing but raved about it all weekend.

Name: Halls Chophouse
Comment: A very enjoyable experience from start to finish. Tyler and Shawna were both awesome.

Name: Halls Chophouse
Comment: Absolutely amazing food and staff! Can’t wait to take my wife back! Get the bone in filet if available.

Name: Halls Chophouse
Comment: Just incredible-we loved our evening there!

Name: Halls Chophouse
Comment: Unbelievably the best restaurant we’ve ever been too! From the greeting at the door to the wonderful service from our waitress Megan we were blown away!!! The steaks are amazing and cooked to perfection! Bread pudding is a must for dessert! Can’t wait to go back when we are back in SC!

Name: Halls Chophouse
Comment: Our meal was superb and the service was outstanding. Loved the special birthday dessert which was generous, delicious, and came with champagne for all! A perfect family celebration of a special birthday.

Name: Halls Chophouse
Comment: The meal was exceptional! Even received a hand written thank you card in the mail afterwards! Didn't like that you needed to Valet park and the it very noisy but the food was out of this world. We would go back in a heartbeat!

Name: Halls Chophouse
Comment: Our server was delightful and very helpful. We were 2 women, and didn’t want to overeat, so w truly appreciated her guidance with the menu selection.  We started with a Pomegranate martini, and it was delicious. The veal chop was perfect, as were our sides.  It was our first time in Charleston, and I’m sure we’ll be back, and definitely come  back to Hall’s.

Name: Halls Chophouse
Comment: This was our second visit to Hall's Chophouse, but our first for their brunch.  We both enjoyed a cup of she crab soup, I had the crab cakes benedict and my husband had a bone in rib eye with mashed potatoes.  Both dishes were outstanding!  I wish I could eat there every day.  Loved talking with the owner and the staff.  They made us feel welcome and they were glad we decided to join them.  Oh, and the gospel singers were out of this world.  We had a great time.  We'll be back.

Name: Halls Chophouse
Comment: This was our first time and the waiter was very helpful.  He asked us what we like and then made suggestions based on the information we gave.  It was my birthday and I do like the fact I didn't have to pull my drivers license out to prove it.  I look forward to the next time.

Name: Halls Chophouse
Comment: Full disclosure: I never made it to dinner.Restaurant staff informed me that they would call me and let me know if they would be open following a recent hurricane scare.  Never got a call and missed what I had hoped was going to be great birthday for my wife.  Things get crazy on the coast during a hurricane event and things like forgetting about a reservation you promised to call are going to happen at even the best establishments.  I really want to like this restaurant, as they have plans to open a location near me, so I will wait another 3 months for a Saturday night to open up and give it a second chance.  This review will be updated at that time.  In the meantime, I would recommend other diners be vigilant and double check reservations and conversations with restaurant staff.

Name: Halls Chophouse
Comment: Absolutely an amazing experience!! The food was out of this world and staff was exceptional. This is an absolute Charleston MUST!!!!

Name: Halls Chophouse
Comment: Birthday dinner was phenomenal

Name: Halls Chophouse
Comment: Excellent food and service.  We love this place.  Best food and service around.

Name: Halls Chophouse
Comment: Awesome every time— a must stop while in the area Great bar dining as well

Name: Halls Chophouse
Comment: HANDS DOWN THIS WAS OUR BEST RESTAURANT EXPERIENCE EVER!!

Name: Halls Chophouse
Comment: We are Charleston locals and finally made it to Halls to celebrate my husband and I’s Birthdays. The service was impeccable and our dinner was perfect. We had very high expectations going in and they were exceeded! We will definitely be back to Halls!

Name: Halls Chophouse
Comment: Went above and beyond to make it a very personal experience for a recent engagement

Name: Halls Chophouse
Comment: Visited after relocating from Texas to Charlotte.  This was the best meal, service & steak that I've ever eaten - EVER.  The owners are people friendly, and love to mingle amongst their guest.  GREAT JELLY BEANS!!!!  This is a restaurant you will not want to miss!!!

Name: Halls Chophouse
Comment: When in Charleston dining at Halls Chop House and other Hall Family owned restaurants is a MUST!

Name: Halls Chophouse
Comment: Billy Hall is a legend . Went down for my Bachelor party with a group of 12. Outstanding steak and great service. The owner ( Billy) shakes everyone’s hand as they walk in and visits every table. The personalized dining experience is a lost art.

Name: Halls Chophouse
Comment: The place was phenomenal.  The food was spot on.  Would recommend for dinner.

Name: Halls Chophouse
Comment: We consider Hall's Chophouse Charleston to be the finest restaurant in Charleston.  Plain and simple.  We walk in the front door to be greeted by Billy Hall who immediately makes us feel like family!  We are always greeted by genuine smiles by the entire staff.  The waiters / waitresses are routinely right there when we need them and inconspicuous when we don't need them.  The food is cooked to perfection (once delivered to our table, the waiter always makes us cut our steak to check the cook of the meat).  The waiter's knowledge of the menu is extraordinary.If I had a complaint, it would be that our dinner is always so delicious and filling that we never have room to try your desserts.  We're gonna have to work on that!Thank you Hall Family and Hall's Chophouse for always making us feel like part of your extended family.

Name: Halls Chophouse
Comment: We had a fantastic meal, visiting for a special occasion. For starter, I had the best onion soup I have ever had. It had the addition of onion rings piled on top and I have asked my wife to add it to her own recipe!I then had a delicious steak whilst my wife had the succulent lamb. I finished with a yum bread pudding with a whiskey sauce. Not a cheap meal but absolutely delicious and I would highly recommend a visit.

Name: Halls Chophouse
Comment: Great time with visiting family. Folks were great with our 3 grandsons!!

Name: Halls Chophouse
Comment: Our favorite Charleston spot by far!   The staff and the family of Hall’s are incredible.   Food is always amazing.

Name: Halls Chophouse
Comment: Have heard of Halls for ages, but never had indulged on one of my frequent trips to Charleston. The reputation is for excellent food and outstanding service. My son, on an earlier visit with friends, proclaimed to the world that he had enjoyed the best steak he’d ever eaten. My two friends and I concurred that the service was superb and the steaks among the best ever. However, there was one shortcoming: the onion rings!!! I consider myself a connoisseur. The onion rings served that evening were very large - fine - but coated in a heavy, doughy batter. The batter must be light, flaky. Overall perfection is so close. Let the onion rings lead Halls to its culinary apotheosis!!!

Name: Halls Chophouse
Comment: Best Restaurant in the US!!!

Name: Halls Chophouse
Comment: Food and service were absolutely amazing and the handwritten thank you note that followed was definitely a special touch.  Probably the best restaurant I've found in SC.

Name: Halls Chophouse
Comment: Service was amazing! Worth every penny! Dina was our server and went above and beyond!

Name: Halls Chophouse
Comment: BEST EVER!  We went for the gospel brunch and decided to go back for dinner the next day.  We never repeat restaurants when on vacay but this was a must!  The owner was extremely hospitable and made us feel like VIP guests and looking around the restaurant, everyone was treated that way.  Best food and service in Charleston and probably the US.  I will visit every trip and tell all my friends!

Name: Halls Chophouse
Comment: If you know you will be in  Charleston on a Sunday morning, please make reservations for the Gospel Brunch at Halls.  The food was fantastic, the service was flawless and the music was great!  Billy Hall was there the moment we walked in the door with a lovely greeting, and he even checked in a few times to see if were were enjoying our meal.  I have never experienced customer service like this.  True southern charm.  We will be back the next time we are in Charleston.

Name: Halls Chophouse
Comment: Waiter was very attentive. We had reservations and got seated promptly. Or steak was cooked a perfect medium rare just like we requested.

Name: Halls Chophouse
Comment: Literally the best dinner of my life. The customer service and quality of food were amazing! Mr. Hall was there and was so kind and took care of two of the guys who’s birthdays we were celebrating. We got a thank you card in the mail after. I would go back in a heart beat and plan on it!

Name: Halls Chophouse
Comment: Excellent service as always.

Name: Harold Black
Comment: Love coming to HB, they make great drinks and have an amazing atmosphere.

Name: Harold Black
Comment: Went on Friday & had a great time. The ambiance was on point. The old fashioned and the wine was delicious. We did a half meet & cheese tray and found it was very good. Minimal with the cheese, but delicious. Plan to spend what you would on a "fancier" date night. We will definitely go back.

Name: Harold Black
Comment: The food and drinks were excellent, but our service was pretty lousy. We were seated in a booth and our server rarely checked up on us (we only got our water refilled once, I ended up taking my glass with me when I went to the bathroom). My boyfriend had trouble getting in because the host didn’t hear him knock, which was really awkward. Also, the pen they gave me to sign the check completely exploded over my hands. I think it’ll be ok for drinks - they really were fantastic - but I wouldn’t come back here for dinner.

Name: Harold Black
Comment: Such a unique and enjoyable environment - staff is always courteous and engaging. Unparalleled cocktail preparation and presentation. Perfect late nite spot

Name: Harold Black
Comment: This is our fav date spot in DC. It’s not pretentious but lovely, dark, and romantic. It’s well run, attentive, but we’ve never once had the awful experience of being deep into a conversation only to be awkwardly interrupted by a server who could care less. I also love that it’s not loud. The drinks are wonderful and they can make anything you like.

Name: Harold Black
Comment: Great place. Friendly service. A little pricey but they certainly know what they’re doing. Highly recommend just giving the bartenders some guide rails and seeing what they come up with.

Name: Harold Black
Comment: I had an amazing time at Harold Black on a Tuesday night.Speakeasy rule -- sit at the bar if you can. You see the art of creating your drink. You hear interesting tidbits and stories. You bond with your bartender and your imagination won't run wild with ideas that you're not important or that this speakeasy is too pretentious. It's not.While the drink menu was a little more limited what I had was great. A truly spicy cocktail with smoky mezcal? Sign me up. Best part? The bartender can customize to your tastes and needs. My friend thought her old fashioned was too sweet. 'No problem, allow me to make you something like a vieux carre and here's exactly why I am using what I am using.' And then thoughtful bar bites which weren't an afterthought for the drink but actually tasty? Gimme that Chicken Tinga Sandwich and an order of the lamb chops for my homegirl please! The R&B music (yaaasssss! to that) had me swaying, the drinks had me relaxed and the convo had me joyful--  this was a laid back speakeasy experience (And trust me, I've tried many in the area).Four stars because it was great time but it truly was a LITTLE too dim and there could be more drinks but I loved this place. Will be back!

Name: Harold Black
Comment: Great cocktails. Pricy but great atmosphere. Not too loud. Great service

Name: Harold Black
Comment: It was our 22nd anniversary and I thought we’d do something a little different. Found this gem on a top places to go list and immediately placed a reservation. The ambiance was amazing, food was excellent the bartenders kept us entertained. Seating, well....for an anniversary date, I’d rather not have to sit at the bar but we made due. I wouldn’t suggested it for a special “special” occasion. Great for a nice date night or outing with friends.

Name: Harold Black
Comment: this is one of the best bars in DC. a hidden gem in the heart of the city with the best bar tenders, service and ambience

Name: Harold Black
Comment: Outstanding experience. Beautiful atmosphere and every drink was delicious. These guys are experts.

Name: Harold Black
Comment: Bartenders not friendly.

Name: Harold Black
Comment: This place was the perfect date night spot. The ambiance was perfect. The music was on point. The food and drinks were amazing and the bartender (Denasha) provided excellent service and great conversation! We will be back for sure!

Name: Harold Black
Comment: LOVED our time at Harold Black. It has such a cozy, cool and chill vibe. The drinks are delicious. Loved the dark ambiance lit by candlelight. Good for conversation. Service was great - a balance of attentive vs. letting you be, to enjoy your time. Cocktails were delicious. Awesome music too. I did not want to leave!! Take note of their house rules too - most importantly tables are for two hours since the joint is small.

Name: Harold Black
Comment: We enjoyed everything about it!  Great, attentive staff.  Delish small plates.  Creative cocktails.  Fantastic, intimate 'date night' spot.

Name: Harold Black
Comment: This place never fails for good drink and intimate settings.  They have light fare menu--which is great to have while drinking.

Name: Harold Black
Comment: Good date. I have spoken

Name: Harold Black
Comment: Ambiance was nice but the host asked us to leave after we had got done signing our bill. We were also seated where “guests are placed when they don’t have a reservation” - in the back corner. But we did have a reservation for my 30th birthday. Disappointed in the treatment by the host but it is what it is

Name: Harold Black
Comment: Food & drinks were good. Waiter very friendly. However, a food order & a drink order never made it to the kitchen or bar. But waiter very apologetic & gave us a complimentary very good cheese board.

Name: Harold Black
Comment: I thought the ambiance was fantastic and the bar tenders were really friendly. My only criticism would be that the bar tenders did not dress according to the theme of the establishment. It would have added so much more had the bar tenders worn something of the period. Suits, hats ect... to keep the vibe persistent.

Name: Harold Black
Comment: Fabulous in every way, except no one told us there was a two hour time limit due to another reservation after ours, and they asked if I wanted a third drink with 10 minutes left. I would have liked more time so as to enjoy the drink instead of gulping down a $15 cocktail when we were told our time was up.

Name: Harold Black
Comment: This place is a joke. Save your money.  Service is poor. Staff is rude. I would never go back to this establishment.

Name: Harold Black
Comment: Great drinks in a cool atmosphere.

Name: Harold Black
Comment: Very cool place! Will definitely be back!

Name: Harold Black
Comment: Just a very chill vibe. Relaxed. Great cocktails.

Name: Harold Black
Comment: This is a great speakeasy for a date-night. The menu isn't extensive, but the execution is solid and they don't skimp on you. We got the cheese plate, meatballs, and brussel sprouts and were quite satisfied. The cocktails we tried were also really nice.  One thing to keep in mind is that the music is kept fairly loud even when the restaurant is not very full, which may not be the vibe you're looking for.

Name: Harold Black
Comment: Cool speakeasy venue. Stairway dark. Cool hidden bathrooms    Fun atmosphere. Limit food choices.  Pricey. Won’t take cash

Name: Harold Black
Comment: As usual HB delivered great atmosphere and wonderful drinks!

Name: Harold Black
Comment: Excellent ambiance, service and people! Perfect for a date

Name: Harold Black
Comment: Fun speakeasy in Eastern Market.  The third time we've been there and we bring different friends each time.  The drinks are great, and to really take advantage of their mixology skills you need to give them a few hints and let them create something for you.  We didn't get any food this time.   It is expensive but the experience is worth it.

Name: Harold Black
Comment: One of the best speakeasy bars in the city! Loved the drinks and the ambiance.

Name: Harold Black
Comment: Terrible service. Sat there for two hours and was only served two drinks

Name: Harold Black
Comment: Fantastic ambiance! Cocktails were fine but honestly nothing special special about them. Service was “meh”. Worth it for the ambiance though!

Name: Harold Black
Comment: As always, absolutely amazing experience. Great service and talented bartenders.

Name: Harold Black
Comment: Unfortunately one of the bigger disappointments I’ve had in DC. Wonderful atmosphere and decor, but the worst bar tending experience I’ve had. The bartender asked order, made several drinks in front of us, and then after 15min, asked our order again. 15min later, she asked us again. Then after another 10 she brought us one drink (there were two is us) that wasn’t remotely what we ordered. So 45min after we first ordered we got our drinks. There were only about 12-15 of us in the entire bar so it was rather surprising. Throughout the night the bartender also repeatedly spilled iced on the bar and therefore us. Heard so much about this bar, but unfortunately this wasn’t its night.

Name: Harold Black
Comment: Great speak easy with an old world vibe. Walk in a secret entrance and knock on an unmarked door to enter a candle lit, quiet, rustic bar.

Name: Harold Black
Comment: Service was not great, as usual, there and in Aqua al Due, its owner.  Hoping it will improve soon.

Name: Harold Black
Comment: Harold Black is a great “speakeasy.”  Exceptionally good cocktails, fine bar snacks, and super service.  To illustrate: the bar snack we ordered was a bit too highly seasoned for my companion.  So the server arranged for the kitchen to produce another version of the dish without the spice!  Amazing!  I shall return to Harold Black!

Name: Harold Black
Comment: Very cool speakeasy, enjoyed myself thoroughly and it was a huge plus for my date (who is a bartender) who said that she loved it. Earned me bonus points for finding such a cool bar.

Name: Harold Black
Comment: Awesome cocktails, delicious lemon-artichoke hummus (I’ll be back for the chocolate cake) and flawless service. The bartendress was very engaging and made us feel most welcome. We had such a great time that we had to reminded to leave after 3 hours to let the next reservation come in ;)

Name: Heirloom Cafe
Comment: Husbands Birthday!

Name: Heirloom Cafe
Comment: I'll begin this review by saying that I had been looking forward to, and tried to find an occasion to visit Heirloom Cafe for a very long time. I've lived in San Francisco now for a year and have had dozens of dining recommendations, but I found this one on my own and was excited to visit a local gem in my neighborhood of the Mission. When one of my hometown friends visited, I wanted to bring her, and my local friend in SF for a ladies' dinner on a Saturday night. The food - delicious, presentable, a great portion. We had the fettucine and salmon and both were divine. The wine selection - abundant, knowledgeable, perfectly dry white and rosé to our taste preferences. The ambiance - candlelit, dim, great for close colleagues, friends, or a date. What completely turned us off however, was one of the servers.1. She seemed to be under the influence. Her words were slurred, and she approached our table in jerky movements.2. Our third guest arrived a bit after us, and about a minute after sitting down, the server came to our table and said "What's the gameplan" without asking to see if she had a chance to review the menu and decide  3. She accidentally knocked over the entire water decanter onto my friend's seating area, lap, and jacket. she didn't apologize but instead said "it can be refreshing". she continued to wipe it while not noticing that she was carrying 2 more decanters in her arm that continued to pour out - luckily a few other servers came to dry up the area 4. We left a nominal tip instead, and she came to the table while we were sitting there, stared closely at the receipt, and marched away to show her manager. Heirloom cafe: your other servers, from what we could tell, seemed to provide good service. We also spoke a few times to who we believe might be an owner and he was great. You should re-consider this server that has left an incredibly bad taste in our mouths and we will not be returning, nor recommending it.

Name: Heirloom Cafe
Comment: We introduced our friends and neighbors to Heirloom the other night. They were very impressed with the menu and presentation and overall excellent repast! I am certain they will be back to experience the restaurant again.  We, of course, visit as frequently as we are able. Thank you - Heirloom crew - for always providing a terrific dinner for us and our family.

Name: Heirloom Cafe
Comment: Great neighborhood restaurant. We had the halibut ceviche and the pod salad.  Entrees were the Salmon and steak babette. Added the oatmeal chocolate cookie and bitter sweet chocolate budino.

Name: Heirloom Cafe
Comment: Low key and excellent, fresh food. Service was also excellent! Can’t wait to go back!

Name: Heirloom Cafe
Comment: I ordered the halibut ceviche and the bean salad while my partner ordered the chicken with corn salsa looking thing...the bean salad was exceptional. His chicken was good but too salty. Overall, a solid B+.  My ceviche had some big pieces of fish and when I pointed it out, the waitress said that is the way the chef likes it...Duh...I was not born yesterday and I do know how to make better ceviche.   And the waitress was either drunk or high on something the way she moved...not cool for her or the restaurant.

Name: Heirloom Cafe
Comment: Service was excellent - friendly and knowledgeable- made good recommendations.

Name: Heirloom Cafe
Comment: We had a wonderful dinner and service was spot on. Bacon and onion tart was flakey crust and perfectly seasoned topping. Salad pulled from the prix fixe menu was refreshing and had some unexpected ingredients, probably listed on the menu but forgotten in the interim. Roasted king salmon with veggies was delicious but trés petite. And dessert of berries with polenta cake was tip top. Loved the French-sourced sauvignon blanc. Restaurant was loud but it's hard these days to find one conducive to conversation where cuisine holds no surprises, however well prepared it may be.

Name: Heirloom Cafe
Comment: We love eating at heirloom the people the food it’s all outstanding!!!

Name: Heirloom Cafe
Comment: We were disappointed.  Portions were very small.  Overpriced.  Noise terrible.

Name: Heirloom Cafe
Comment: Heirloom brings a sophistication to comfort food that makes it a great weeknight choice. A summer evening with corn chowder and the (off-menu) burger is a delight.  Service is friendly and attentive.  Tables are a bit tight, and noise can be a bit of a distraction, particularly when seated next to a couple of folks convinced they are about to conquer the world.   While not regulars, we have returned to Heirloom regularly over the years and never been disappointed.

Name: Heirloom Cafe
Comment: Best servers. I want to be friends with them. Food is always on point.

Name: Heirloom Cafe
Comment: Always very special hospitality. Fantastic wine list!

Name: Heirloom Cafe
Comment: The  succotash was tasty but the chicken was very dry and not good

Name: Heirloom Cafe
Comment: We loved the Heirloom Cafe! The food was excellent. Our waiter was so nice to us. We thought he was exceptionally so. We would definitely return but it would be a special occasion destination for us considering the cost.

Name: Heirloom Cafe
Comment: Amazing, always great. A little pricey, but nothing out of the ordinary for SF. Enjoy!

Name: Heirloom Cafe
Comment: Lovely food snd lovely service

Name: Heirloom Cafe
Comment: Excellent food! Great service! It was noisy and hard to have a quiet conversation.

Name: Heirloom Cafe
Comment: A waiter that wasn’t present and pretty incompetent and since the restaurant was loud could hardly hear what he was saying. He spoke so softly. And didn’t seem to have a knowledge of the menu. Also not a lot of personality or attention to our table.

Name: Heirloom Cafe
Comment: Went to dinner after a show; the food was SO delicious and what wonderful service. Have come to Heirloom Cafe several times and have never been disappointed.

Name: Heirloom Cafe
Comment: As always, great dinner.

Name: Heirloom Cafe
Comment: Very good food; generous portions.  Matt, the owner is a pure delight and the wait staff was excellent.  Wish it wasn’t so noisy for us seniors .

Name: Heirloom Cafe
Comment: Mussels were so good that I ordered it twice!

Name: Heirloom Cafe
Comment: I love Heirloom Cafe and don’t dine here often enough.  The neighborhood feel, friendliness and competence of the staff, and the sumptuous authentic food keep Heirloom at the top of my list!

Name: Heirloom Cafe
Comment: The waitstaff was underwhelmed to see me and I them. The burger and salads were quite tasty but the fettuccine was undercooked. Plates were small and not elevated enough to be worth the price. I can’t recommend this restaurant.

Name: Heirloom Cafe
Comment: I really enjoyed my overall experience at Heirloom Cafe and would be somewhere that I return. All the dishes were quite tasty and incorporated flavors that you can't just simply make at home. Nothing was too salty or bland. The wine suggested was superb and paired well with the food. The waitress was warm, funny, sweet. The ambiance was cozy and romantic (dim lit with candles, wooden tables).

Name: Heirloom Cafe
Comment: Food and service was simply fantastic. It has an old feel with modern food. Felt like a great modern community feel.

Name: Heirloom Cafe
Comment: We had a number of guests in our group of 8 with specific dietary needs. The staff went above and beyond. Highly recommend. They even have a large table that easily fits parties of 12 which a real find in the city.

Name: Heirloom Cafe
Comment: Heirloom Cafe is the best. Food, wine and service are top of the top. Love it.

Name: Heirloom Cafe
Comment: Dining at Heirloom is one of the great pleasures of living in the Mission -- or of visiting it.  Once the most tagged corner in the neighborhood, this sweet little spot now serves fresh, beautiful food with a simple, elegant aesthetic.  The staff is lovely and the meals are beautifully prepared.  The seasonal menu is complemented by a thoughtfully composed wine list -- and to say the atmosphere is charming doesn't begin do it justice.  Behind the gauzy curtains, the hubbub of the City fades away in a grand, open room that quickly fills with a pleasant crowd of diners who've dressed a bit for the occasion, and whose convivial conversations punctuate what always turns into a memorable night.  Even if we didn't live on the same block, we'd love it just as much as we already do!

Name: Heirloom Cafe
Comment: Great place before a show(Beautiful- Carol King). fun art deco vibe and bar drinks. meal was superb. parked a couple blocks away and had to negotiate sketchy street scene but worth it once arriving.  amazing kale salad!  will return.

Name: Heirloom Cafe
Comment: Great place that's reasonably priced for the quality of food. Not a lot of selection, but everything was delicious. The wine paring is great with pre-fix menu.

Name: Heirloom Cafe
Comment: Delightful neighborhood spot for celebrating our anniversary. The food and wine were exceptional. The house made fettuccini is a must order (I don't even like mushrooms and this was a standout dish). They also let you share a single order of the prix fixe which is a fantastic deal as it includes generous individual pours and the perfect amount of food to share when you add in an entree. We were both full, but not uncomfortably so. There's no way we could have eaten more! Especially pleased with how perfectly the wine complemented the food (really smart pairings) and how we got to try wines we wouldn't have otherwise known anything about. Will definitely recommend Heirloom to friends and family and look forward to the next occasion that brings us back here.

Name: Heirloom Cafe
Comment: The food and service were absolutely solid. I eat here fairly often and have had almost no misses. This time I brought a friend with me who had never eaten at Heirloom - he was impressed!

Name: Heirloom Cafe
Comment: Lovely, per usual. Beautiful setting and the food is always simple but perfect.

Name: Heirloom Cafe
Comment: Great service Delicious food

Name: Heirloom Cafe
Comment: This was our first time dining here and really enjoyed a midweek birthday dinner. Service was so warm and welcoming and every dish was delish! Looking forward to a return visit soon.

Name: Heirloom Cafe
Comment: Nice restaurant. Good service from quality people. Excellent wine list.  Could use a broader menu selection.

Name: Heirloom Cafe
Comment: Neighborhood gem, but timing was a bit off. We were served our dishes randomly so no one ate together. They were aware, and apologetic. I’m sure it was just one of those things that happen. Great place otherwise. Wine menu is fabulous. Highly recommend.

Name: Heirloom Cafe
Comment: Service was very good, we were seated promptly at our reservation time. Our server was warm and friendly. Background noise was quite loud which made it difficult to hear and the lighting was very dim. The food was beautifully presented but the tuna tartare was bland. The duck salad was slightly dry but had a nice flavor. The burger was definitely the tastiest. The wine was awesome and reasonably priced. Overall the experience was pleasant but with so many other places to choose from, I don't think we'll return anytime soon.

Name: Hersh's
Comment: This was our first date night since opening up post (more intense) quarantine, and it was the perfect situation. I felt so safe. All disposable cutlery etc, distancing between tables, all outside dining, staff wearing masks were all factors that contributed to our experience. Great food and great experience. Highly recommend!

Name: Hersh's
Comment: Always great!

Name: Hersh's
Comment: Great service. Amazing food. They never disappoint.

Name: Hersh's
Comment: Always great food - meatball appetizer and margherita pizza - really good.

Name: Hersh's
Comment: Service was outstanding, pizza was amazing - highly recommend! Def. need a reservation, walk-ins  esp on weekends are unlikely.

Name: Hersh's
Comment: Their food is absolutely delicious. Love coming here for cocktails or special occasions.

Name: Hersh's
Comment: Every time we go, it is the best food I’ve ever eaten.

Name: Hersh's
Comment: Awesome. Period.

Name: Hersh's
Comment: Hersh's is  a great date night spot! The pizza is delicious as well as all of the apps. We tried the Il Rubicon pizza and loved it!

Name: Hersh's
Comment: A bit on the expensive side, but definitely worth it for a special occasion. I'd definitely go back!

Name: Hersh's
Comment: Magical as always - Hersh's always delivers with a fantastic meal

Name: Hersh's
Comment: One of THE BEST pasta dishes I’ve had in my life. Server was great and knew the menu well.

Name: Hersh's
Comment: Never had anything but a 5 star experience here!  New people we brought were just as impressed.  Never lets us down when bringing new friends.  Best pizza, frehsest homemade pasta, and those meatballs!  Mmm...Josh and team kill it every. single. time!

Name: Hersh's
Comment: We love Hersh’s. Food was excellent as always. Service excellent as always. Really fun date night spot.

Name: Hersh's
Comment: Hersh's is the best overall restaurant in Federal Hill, without doubt. Consistently great food, service and atmosphere.  You can always count on a few menu staples, yet they mix it up just enough to keep it interesting. Special shout out to long-time staff member Shannon!

Name: Hersh's
Comment: Love this place! Food, wine & service are consistently very, very good.

Name: Hersh's
Comment: A wonderful meal once again.  New item on the menu, pork belly with shredded brussel sprouts and almonds was amazing.  Also loved the arugula salad and scallops with cauliflower risotto.  Hershs never disappoints with an amazing chef and a super efficient, friendly staff.

Name: Hersh's
Comment: We love this place! It is consistent and delicious. Their happy hour drink specials are a good deal - we go at least once a month

Name: Hersh's
Comment: Great! My new favorite spot for cocktails and high-end eats. I recommend the chopped salad!

Name: Hersh's
Comment: There were 5 of us so they put us upstairs. The decor is quite minimal. The drinks were good. We all liked the meatballs, the Brussels sprouts, the octopus, La Salsiccia pizza, the Atlantic cod. We didn’t like the clam pie, too salty and the Tagliolini had a lot of sand in it and lacked flavors. For dessert, we shared the Haze Bomb which was just ok and the donuts which everyone liked.

Name: Hersh's
Comment: Always excellent!!

Name: Hersh's
Comment: We love this place! We go for special occasions, everyday dining and family get togethers. The food is quality and always on point. They have a great happy hour on fridays and if u like wine or beer this is the time to go. It’s pricy but so worth it. It is literally our favorite restaurant In the world and we have had pizza in Italy! It is better here. Trust me

Name: Hersh's
Comment: Outstanding as always!

Name: Hersh's
Comment: Fantastic meal start to finish!!!

Name: Hersh's
Comment: Never disappoints! Try the eggnog! Chopped Salad had a great spice to it.

Name: Hersh's
Comment: Great food!

Name: Hersh's
Comment: Hersh’s never disappoints!

Name: Hersh's
Comment: Good time with family- food was good a bit pricey and small portions- service not as good as other reviewers experienced

Name: Hersh's
Comment: Food is always good and creative. Service very good.

Name: Hersh's
Comment: Never disappoints ever!

Name: Hersh's
Comment: Hersh's is always good. House-made pasta.  Good whiskey, beer, and wine.  During the week they have happy hour until 7, featuring a $5 red or white, cocktail specials, and flights of beer.

Name: Hersh's
Comment: It is a small menu but the food was good

Name: Hersh's
Comment: We love Hersh’s. Food is always generously seasoned and eclectic and different than anywhere else in Baltimore. Service Is always good too. The portions aren’t big enough though. We usually have to order a lot of food to leave satisfied. Still, we come back for it because it’s always a pleasant experience.

Name: Hersh's
Comment: Our new fav place! Food is incredible staff is great vibe is perf!

Name: Hersh's
Comment: Good like always.  My wife and I dine there frequently. Several dishes are available in small and large size choices.  Thant's perfect for us as were can share appetizers and each get a small dish.  We usually split a salad and an octopus, then go for any of their pastas.

Name: Hersh's
Comment: When you walk in on a Wednesday night and the place is full, you know it’s good!!

Name: Hersh's
Comment: Can’t get enough of that wood fired pizza! The pumpkin app was delicious and we were excited to have made it for happy hour drinks!

Name: Hersh's
Comment: Excellent dinner as always!  Service was great, and food was outstanding.

Name: Hersh's
Comment: The menu changes daily. We decided to split the chopped salad which was delicious.  We each ordered a pizza, one with various meats and the other, mushroom. The pizza was tasty, thin crust but a little bit too oily for my taste (mushroom). Had I known, I would have asked that they hold on adding oil.  The server was excellent.  She checked back often and it was clear that they wanted us to be happy.

Name: Hersh's
Comment: Our server didn't write our order down and ended up forgetting two items, but we didn't care because we love Hersh's so much! The menu changes with the seasons and everything was delicious!

Name: The Inn at Little Washington
Comment: Best romantic I ever had with my wife. It was everything I imagined it to be and more.

Name: The Inn at Little Washington
Comment: Wonderful ambience. Impeccable service , fabulous food!

Name: The Inn at Little Washington
Comment: Foods and services at this restaurant are excellent.  Very nice and cozy decoration.  Highly recommended!

Name: The Inn at Little Washington
Comment: The atmosphere is exceptional.  The food portions were perfect.  There were several offerings compliments of the chef.  We consider ourselves foodies and have dined inside and outside the U.S.   The chef’s selections were delicious.  However, the price for the dining experience, especially the wine pricing was unnecessarily exorbitant.  The wine we ordered was $40 per glass or the wine pairing was $170.  These prices could not be justified.  It was a once in a lifetime experience and not to be repeated.

Name: The Inn at Little Washington
Comment: Sommelier and waiter we're fantastic. Met chef O'Connell when asked. Great experience and food.

Name: The Inn at Little Washington
Comment: We visited the Inn last night for our 5th wedding anniversary. This was our first time at the Inn and we appreciate the opportunity. I am going to be honest with my review and please keep in mind that this is my personal opinion. It might sound nitpicky but I think that you earn the right to nitpick if you shell out this amount of money for food :)I have been to one other restaurant with a similar structure and that is Marcel's by Robert Wiedmaier in DC. We went there for our 1st wedding anniversary so I will compare both restaurants.The quality of the cuisine is similar at both restaurants and there is very little that sets them apart. The wine pairing and selections was outstanding at both restaurants. Marcel's provided multiple "entremets" between courses and the Inn did not do so. When it comes to table service, the only area where the Inn performed better than Marcel's was the enthusiasm and interaction we received from the waiter, Andrew. However, the waiter at Marcel's was still very good. He performed all his table service at a higher level of technical service. The table was cleaned thoroughly and properly in between courses by Marcel's while at the Inn the table was just not cleaned and cleared properly. The waiter at the table next to us dropped used utensils on a customer which is a massive offense for a 3 star restaurant. Additionally, the sommelier at the Inn poured the incorrect for the wine pairing at dessert. While the experience at both restaurants was very good, Marcel's provided a slightly better dining experience. We certainly did not leave hungry from the Inn and are glad to have the opportunity to dine at an acclaimed restaurant, we think that these little things are worth noting when dining at a restaurant of this level.

Name: The Inn at Little Washington
Comment: This restaurant is a true gem.  The quality of everything is amazing.  A good place to splurge on a special occasion.  But you must make reservations as far in advance as possible.

Name: The Inn at Little Washington
Comment: Our evening at the Inn at Little Washington was exceptional! They made my husband's birthday feel so special. The food, service, and ambiance were all delightful and memorable. Every dish was perfectly composed and delicious. Service was perfect, we never wanted for anything but were left alone so we can carry on a conversation. Everything felt intimate, romantic, and serene. The highlight was being able to see the kitchen and meet Chef O'Connell. My only small criticism is with the wine pairings. I didn't love a lot of the selections and especially did not like the Riesling. It was so sweet I didn't even drink it. The server who was pouring the wines noticed and commented on my full glass yet never offered a replacement pairing which I would have appreciated.

Name: The Inn at Little Washington
Comment: Interesting place and very odd staff.  Food is excellent.

Name: The Inn at Little Washington
Comment: From the moment we arrived until we left this was a unique and incredible dining experience. Food and service are impeccable. Thank you for a great experience both dining and lodging. We will be back.

Name: The Inn at Little Washington
Comment: Delicious food although a tad inconsistent. We also had to wait wayyyy too long for the cheese and dessert course. To their credit they comped the cheese course.

Name: The Inn at Little Washington
Comment: Birthday & Anniversary

Name: The Inn at Little Washington
Comment: The best meal of our lives. The food is worth  a trip from any corner of the globe. Wine lovers are better off pulling a gem from their cellar rather than the pairings which, while varied, were somewhat pedestrian.

Name: The Inn at Little Washington
Comment: From the moment we crossed the street and were greeted with an dapper seer-sucker dressed man with an umbrella, to the moment we left, with all staff wishing us farewell, it was an amazing experience. Thank you for making our first anniversary as special as it felt. Keep up the excellent work!

Name: The Inn at Little Washington
Comment: The experience was exquisite replete with visual beauty, heavenly aromas, in captivating textures and blissful flavors. This is the best dining experience in the New World. Thank you for the memories!

Name: The Inn at Little Washington
Comment: Disappointing, considering it is a three star Michelin restaurant.

Name: The Inn at Little Washington
Comment: No words can describe how wonderful our visit was...every little details were tended to from the beginning to the ending of our meal. We will have to come up with more reasons to celebrate at the Inn...soon!!!!

Name: The Inn at Little Washington
Comment: Splendid experience, as I had expected.

Name: The Inn at Little Washington
Comment: Best meal ever!  Elegance around every corner.

Name: The Inn at Little Washington
Comment: We had an extraordinary time at the Inn at Little Washington! The server Jessie was wonderful, and made great beverage recommendations. All of the little details!! Customized menus, goodie box of treats to go. It was unbelievable. Each course was amazing and flavorful. They were extremely accommodating to my gluten free dietary restriction. 10/10 would recommend going here for a special occasion.

Name: The Inn at Little Washington
Comment: What can I say about dining here that hasn't already been said. I'm always afraid that I'm hyping this place so much that those who join me will be let down but the Inn consistently exceeds my expectations and those of my guests. I cannot get enough of Cameron and the Moo Cow cheese cart. He is the maestro of cheesy humor. I'll be back again and again.

Name: The Inn at Little Washington
Comment: Creative, perfectly seasoned food paired with excellent service.

Name: The Inn at Little Washington
Comment: Fantastic experience from start to finish.  Amazing food, wine pairings, and staff.

Name: The Inn at Little Washington
Comment: A wonderful time was had by all. The food was delicious and the staff was wonderful. A celebration of birthdays was made even more special by a wonderful and attentive staff. The young man at the front door who welcomed us and parked my car, the welcoming hostess who showed us to our table, Chris who oversaw our dinning experience, the wine expert who suggested a fine bottle of wine, and everyone else who had a hand in bringing food and drink, they all made the experience special. We were seated in an area with five other couples which made for an intimate dinning experience. It was really nice, it made you feel special with all the attention and care.It was really wonderful.

Name: The Inn at Little Washington
Comment: World class!

Name: The Inn at Little Washington
Comment: Beautiful experience! The food was beyond amazing. Words do not do it justice.

Name: The Inn at Little Washington
Comment: It was our 31st Anniversary dinner.  A once in a lifetime dining experience.

Name: The Inn at Little Washington
Comment: Everything was wonderful.  The food, the wine pairing, the explanations, the cheese cart! This was my partner's 60th birthday and they created a keepsake menu.  I had called ahead and paid for a copy of the cookbook and it was waiting for him.  Lovely evening in every way.

Name: The Inn at Little Washington
Comment: Five stars all around. There’s a reason this is a three Michelin star restaurant! Absolutely the finest dining ever! Patrick O’Connel is a genius!

Name: The Inn at Little Washington
Comment: The Inn at Little Washington is a world class experience in every way. It doesn’t get any better. We are so fortunate to have it in our backyard. It’s worth the trip it every time, no matter how far you are traveling to get there!

Name: The Inn at Little Washington
Comment: Its a very nice place but just not a good value. For what it cost it should blow your mind and for me it just didn't. To be fair, its not really my kind of experience. That said, I have been to some highly rated and very pricey restaurants around DC. i.e. Bourboun Steak, Bond 45 and others and was much more satisfied. The service is top notch of course I will give it 5 stars there. But negatives were the seating is close quarters; we were sandwiched a foot away from tables on each side of us and more than once an obnoxious woman next to us jumped into our conversation univited.  Food was good but not mind blowing by any means. Not exactly what I expected for a dinner for 2 at about $750.

Name: The Inn at Little Washington
Comment: Everything from valet service, to meal service, to quality... all excellent! Staff made us feel like family for our Easter gathering. The selection of menus provided excellent choices for each of us. The wine pairings were spot on —and each wine was described in detail, as were the menu items. I really love this place and will go back as often as I can!

Name: The Inn at Little Washington
Comment: Fantastic. This is a jewel.  It has been 20 years since our last visit. We decided it’s worth a visit a couple of times a year. On the way out we were greeted by Luray, the owners Dalmatian. What a treat.

Name: The Inn at Little Washington
Comment: Truly deserves our 6hr drive from NY to enjoy the 5 course meal at The inn at Little Washington. Every service staff from the door man hold the umbrella when we got out of the car to our server and sommelier, and the manager who kindly gave us a kitchen tour are all fabulous. Food was fantastic, truly an amazing experience.

Name: The Inn at Little Washington
Comment: The Inn is always consistent—amazing food, creative presentation, excellent service. Always lives up to our expectations and never disappoints.

Name: The Inn at Little Washington
Comment: Cannot find a better location for comfort, ambiance, great food, and attentive staff.  Can't wait to return.

Name: The Inn at Little Washington
Comment: Worth the hype. Worth the money. Just do yourself a favor and go!

Name: The Inn at Little Washington
Comment: Overall the food and experience was good. TLDR is, it's not worth the price, and DO NOT get the wine pairing. Wine pairing was $170/person. It didn't add anything to the dishes, and you only got 2.5 glasses. Getting a cocktail instead of the wine would have saved us at least $200, and would have had the same food experience. Not only did the wine not add to the food experience, but some were just bad. Some of the dishes were amazing, but for those prices I was expecting every dish to blow me away. Can get similar food/experience for 1/4th the price at nice D.C. restaurants. Portions were small, which is to be expected. But when the tasting menu works out to about $60/dish (before tax and tip) you expect more than one scallop.

Name: The Inn at Little Washington
Comment: Simply outstanding.  Dining at The Inn at Little Washington is a life experience.  It's not for the shy of pallet nor wallet, but that should be expected for a restaurant with _three_ Michelin Stars. The service is exceptional and extremely accommodating; ask and it shall be provided.Plan for as much as three hours for your dining visit.  Lots of courses and many little extra offerings in between.  Dress your best and take your special person for the night of their life.

Name: The Inn at Little Washington
Comment: Delicious and very good but not one of the best meals I’ve ever had. Not necessarily worth the price we paid, but a great experience.  Worth it as a bucket list thing.  The ambience and the service were impeccable.

Name: Seafood
Comment: Dana and Scott the dynamic duo!!!

Name: Seafood
Comment: We were here for our sons 18th bday! Everything was perfect! Will be back!

Name: Seafood
Comment: Service was excellent and the food was even greater. Will definitely come back

Name: Seafood
Comment: First time there , excellent service and food , every employee was excellant  thank you , will return

Name: Seafood
Comment: Absolutely amazing staff and the food was top level as well. Had oysters, crab and steaks and though we ordered way too much it was an amazing day with a great atmosphere.

Name: Seafood
Comment: I was so thankful to be able to dine at Joe’s on the first day of reopening because of Covid. The service was excellent.  And the crab was spectacular as was the ribeye.  Everything was perfect!!  I love this restaurant!  I live in California, so when I come home to Chicago.  I make it one of my destinations.

Name: Seafood
Comment: Always a reliable spot and we hope to return as soon as the health emergency abates.

Name: Seafood
Comment: Dined here on the last night before the mandated shutdown of Chicago restaurants. Food was superb as usual, perfect branzino, sea bass, and mahimahi. Sorry they have to close for a while, but they are doing their best to cooperate in this crisis. The upside was that in the empty room one didn't have to shout to be heard at table. Takeout, carryout will continue, so Joe's good cooking will still be available.

Name: Seafood
Comment: Joe's never disappoints. Denise took excellent care of us from start to finish.

Name: Seafood
Comment: Loved Karen. She is an amazing server.

Name: Seafood
Comment: From the minute we walked in the door we were attended to quickly.  Got  a drink in the  bar  then moved on to our spacious booth where we had the best waiter.  Got me a great deal on small order of crab  legs and entertained us while giving us the best  service.   The place was packed but we had quick service and great ambiance.  Will definitely be back!

Name: Seafood
Comment: We loved our server, Denise! Everything on the menu from the cocktails to the dessert are delicious!

Name: Seafood
Comment: Always lives up to its reputation of excellence.    We had Seafood salad & steak salad both were deliciouskey lime pie. Peanut butter pie and birthday surprise brownie dessert made for a superb festive event.

Name: Seafood
Comment: Steak was delectable. Cooked and seasoned to perfection. Our waiter was very knowledgeable of the wine list and recommended great selections to my party. I would recommend to anyone.

Name: Seafood
Comment: The service at this restaurant is spectacular. We walked in the door and were immediately greeted by numerous servers welcoming us and telling us to have an enjoyable evening. We did have a fabulous evening. The food is incredible!  But, the best part was how well we were taken care of at this  very special restaurant.

Name: Seafood
Comment: This is such a great place to dine! I was I. Town for work and I made reservations for me and my friends. You can never gone ring with a menu choice. While I usually order the stone crab claws, this time I opted for the seafood pasta and finished dinner with key lime pie. It was great! Will always return to Joes!

Name: Seafood
Comment: Highly recommended if you want great food and service.

Name: Seafood
Comment: OutstandingThe Gold Standard in Chicago

Name: Seafood
Comment: Great experience, wonderful staff, best steak I have ever had (Bone in ribeye). The crust on it was very good and flavorful. The restaurant was loud but you could hear those at your table well.

Name: Seafood
Comment: Our Server was outstanding - she was exceptionally knowledgeable on recommending oysters to start.  An absolutely sensational meal and experience.

Name: Seafood
Comment: Enjoyable experience - good food well cooked - good service.  People at the next table were a bit awkward but the staff handled it very well.  Would certainly go back.

Name: Seafood
Comment: A birthday lunch. The steak was great as usual.

Name: Seafood
Comment: Everything was fantastic and we look forward to coming back soon!!  Our waiter was phenomenal!! Food was delicious!  Drinks were amazing!! Dessert was to die for!! Overall an incredible experience!

Name: Seafood
Comment: Delicioso y excelente servicio

Name: Seafood
Comment: Excellent food and service.

Name: Seafood
Comment: Wonderful experience with extremely good food and the most attentive waiter!

Name: Seafood
Comment: Always the best

Name: Seafood
Comment: We were able to get a last min reservation and once we walked in we were seated right away. Our server was nice and explained the menu to us and we truly enjoyed our meal. It was the best steak I have ever eaten and we have eaten a lot of steak.

Name: Seafood
Comment: food and service were great.  had an 8pm reservation and didnt get seated until almost 830pm which was the only negative

Name: Seafood
Comment: Celebrated a Birthday for My Brother-In-Law.  Great service !

Name: Seafood
Comment: Excelente, muy buenos los crab cakes, pero imperdibles los stone crab!!!!!

Name: Seafood
Comment: For cient entertainment you cannot do better than Joe's because everything on the menu from steak to seafood and everything else, is absolutely delicious.

Name: Seafood
Comment: Took my son for his birthday. The food was excellent (the Dover Sole has always been my favorite) and our server, Michelle, was on her game, both engaging and efficient. We had a great time. Definitely recommend.

Name: Seafood
Comment: My Dover Sole was over cooked & dry. Everything else was great.

Name: Seafood
Comment: One word comes to mind, phenomenal!

Name: Seafood
Comment: Awesome fried chicken and onion strings! Cole slaw mixed at the table. Yum!

Name: Seafood
Comment: One of the single most superior restaurants not only in Chicago, but possible in the country !You MUST ask for Denice as your server and if her team includes Jose Luis, be prepared for service fit for the Gods !However, the remainder of the FOH staff is stellar as well !Kudos to the kitchen for quality preparation and impeccable coordination with the server.Three people: Oysters Rock; warm King crab; three orders of stone; and, split a prime bone-in rib eye steak.  Superb !Key lime pie; hot fudge brownie; and, apple pie ala mode.  YUM !Yes, it's expensive but worth ever morsel and ever smile on our faces that Denice put there !

Name: Seafood
Comment: Food was amazing !! Service was also great. The atmosphere is very nice, very upscale and elegant. We will be back soon! Appreciated it being a quiet restaurant so we could actually have a conversation

Name: Seafood
Comment: We went for my hubby’s birthday and had a wonderful experience. Our server was one of the best and our food was fantastic. We will absolutely be back!

Name: Seafood
Comment: I had saved up many LEYE points to use last night. At the completion of dinner I was told that they were not valid on Saturdays.   That was an expensive surprise and frankly, as a person that spends what I spend in a year at LEYE restaurants, I think a better agreement could have been reached.

Name: JUNGSIK
Comment: Great food as usual. Very attentive

Name: JUNGSIK
Comment: It is a good place to celebrate birthday and the environment is good and food is delicious!

Name: JUNGSIK
Comment: very good love the experience

Name: JUNGSIK
Comment: The food, service and ambiance were all exceptional.

Name: JUNGSIK
Comment: Outstanding.  Across the board.  Maybe the best NYC restaurant experience in 25 years.

Name: JUNGSIK
Comment: spectacular food, lovely service, quiet atmosphere a perfec tplace for a special occasion

Name: JUNGSIK
Comment: Our Third year wedding anniversary

Name: JUNGSIK
Comment: Absolutely phenomenal. It was a unique experience of creativity with delicious plates, with atypical takes of high-class dishes with a Korean flair. Would definitely recommend and go again

Name: JUNGSIK
Comment: We dined at 4 other 3-star Michelin restaurants. This one is on par with our other top one in San Francisco Quince. If it was our decision we would give it that final third star to elevate it the highest level. Wonderful presentation, beautiful execution of flavor profiles, service  was well-educated and descriptive while providing attention without interrupting the intimacy of the meal.

Name: JUNGSIK
Comment: A delightful experience, beginning to end. Thank you for an amazing evening!

Name: JUNGSIK
Comment: Incredible tasting menu! Tim was really fun! Thanks great experience! Will be back

Name: JUNGSIK
Comment: Great hospitality, couple unique things they did such as a name on the menu and piping happy birthday on one of the desserts.Black truffle cone was out of this world

Name: JUNGSIK
Comment: As always, Jungsik lives up to its two Michelin stars and demonstrates that it deserves a third star unlike Eleven Madison Park’s oversalted food. The balance of flavors and textures of each dish were spot on, including the cook on the proteins. While the depth of flavor this time was a little bit lower than usual, that’s more if you’re nitpicking and know how good the dishes are usually. Tim, our main table handler, lived up to the standard I have with regards to service, a high bar that was already set by Oscar.
